Subject  :-Re: Using shaded JAR as a dependency in a WAR module
contents:- -----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----&#010;Hash: SHA1&#010;&#010;Ron,&#010;&#010;I'm not sure if it's a better or worse solution. It does minimize the&#010;configuration effort. This is always a good thing when moving people&#010;from Ant to Maven.&#010;&#010;What it does illustrate (at least to me) is that the code base I'm&#010;working with has more technical debts that need to be addressed.&#010;&#010;Also, that the documentation is quite dense - you speed through it at&#010;your peril.&#010;&#010;. . . just my two cents&#010;/mde/&#010;&#010;On 12/5/2014 7:36 PM, Ron Wheeler wrote:&#010;&gt; Great. I hope that the discussion was helpful even if you found a&#010;&gt; better solution.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Ron&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; On 05/12/2014 3:22 PM, Mark Eggers wrote: Ron and Stephen,&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Ron, we cannot use libraries installed into Tomcat's &#010;&gt; $CATALINA_BASE/lib directory for several reasons. While it's nice&#010;&gt; from a developer and deployment point of view, we do end up&#010;&gt; running multiple versions of the WAR file (with different versions&#010;&gt; of various dependencies) on the same Tomcat. We also release the&#010;&gt; WAR file, and it would be difficult to require people to modify&#010;&gt; their server environment.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Thanks! I finally figured it out.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; 1. Issue number 1&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; I was using a POM artifact to aggregate a set of lower level &#010;&gt; libraries. In order to do this, I had to set the following in the &#010;&gt; shade plugin:&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;promoteTransitiveDependencies&gt;true&lt;/promoteTransitiveDependencies&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;  This of course makes perfect sense.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; 2. Issue number 2&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; I needed to set the following:&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;keepDependenciesWithProvidedScope&gt;true&lt;/keepDependenciesWithProvidedScope&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Both of these are mentioned (albeit not as clearly as it might be)&#010;&gt; in the fine documentation here:&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-shade-plugin/shade-mojo.html&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Combining those two creates a JAR with all of the dependency&#010;&gt; pom.xml files in it, as well as the classes / resources / etc. An&#010;&gt; examination of the target WAR file shows a nice, clean WEB-INF/lib&#010;&gt; with managed dependencies all the way down the chain.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; For those people interested, the dependencies and shade plugin &#010;&gt; configuration are given below.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;dependencies&gt; &lt;dependency&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;org.mdeggers&lt;/groupId&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;Calhost&lt;/artifactId&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;version&gt;${calhost.version}&lt;/version&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt; &lt;dependency&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;org.mdeggers&lt;/groupId&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;IHomeResources&lt;/artifactId&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;version&gt;${ihomeresources.version}&lt;/version&gt; &lt;type&gt;pom&lt;/type&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt; &lt;/dependencies&gt;&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;build&gt; &lt;plugins&gt; &lt;plugin&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;org.apache.maven.plugins&lt;/groupId&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-shade-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt; &lt;version&gt;2.3&lt;/version&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt; &lt;executions&gt; &lt;execution&gt; &lt;id&gt;combine&lt;/id&gt; &lt;phase&gt;package&lt;/phase&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt; &lt;goals&gt; &lt;goal&gt;shade&lt;/goal&gt; &lt;/goals&gt; &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;keepDependenciesWithProvidedScope&gt;true&lt;/keepDependenciesWithProvidedScope&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;promoteTransitiveDependencies&gt;true&lt;/promoteTransitiveDependencies&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &#010;&lt;artifactSet&gt;&#010;&gt; &lt;includes&gt; &lt;include&gt;org.mdeggers:*&lt;/include&gt; &lt;/includes&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;/artifactSet&gt; &lt;/configuration&gt; &lt;/execution&gt; &lt;/executions&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;/plugin&gt; &lt;/plugins&gt; &lt;/build&gt;&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Sorry for the line length.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Obviously, if you don't have any transitive dependencies, you&#010;&gt; won't need the promote line.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; It works. Hope this is the correct solution.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; . . . just my two cents /mde/&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; On 12/5/2014 10:57 AM, Ron Wheeler wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Some forums are more concerned about form than content.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Everyone here is pretty focused on solving your problem&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; rather than telling how to post it.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; If you look at the examples in my post, you will see that the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; type is "pom" for dependencies on libraries. We also use&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; "provided" scope since we install the libraries once rather&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; than include them with each upload of a war file since they&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; generally don't change.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; We set the content of our libraries (jars and versions) at&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; the beginning of a release cycle and don't change them for&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; the duration of the release unless there is an emergency.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; This gives everyone a stable environment and once you have&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; the libraries loaded into Tomcat, in our case, they do not&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; change as the application gets worked on. This makes the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; testing go quicker since you are only replacing the war file&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; that you are working on and the war file only contains the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; code that we write.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; I am not sure if this applies to your libraries.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Ron&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On 05/12/2014 12:04 PM, Mark Eggers wrote: Ron,&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Thanks for the link. I'm attempting to do this with the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; shade plugin. I took a look at the JAR that the shade plugin&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; generates with my configuration, and it seems to have the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; pom.xml files from which it was built, but not the reduced&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; dependency pom.xml (or any pom.xml from the built / shaded&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; artifact).&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; This means that I have not configured the shade plugin&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; properly to produce an artifact that can be consumed as if it&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; was built without using the shade plugin.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; The entire list of dependencies for the WAR module:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;dependencies&gt; &lt;dependency&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;org.mdeggers&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;CoreServer&lt;/artifactId&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;version&gt;${coreserver.version}&lt;/version&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;dependency&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;org.mdeggers&lt;/groupId&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;CoreClient&lt;/artifactId&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;version&gt;${coreclient.version}&lt;/version&gt; &lt;type&gt;war&lt;/type&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt; &lt;dependency&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;javax.servlet&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;servlet-api&lt;/artifactId&gt; &lt;version&gt;2.5&lt;/version&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;scope&gt;provided&lt;/scope&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt; &lt;dependency&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;javax.servlet.jsp&lt;/groupId&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;jsp-api&lt;/artifactId&gt; &lt;version&gt;2.1&lt;/version&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;scope&gt;provided&lt;/scope&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt; &lt;dependency&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;org.mdeggers&lt;/groupId&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;GlobalCalcWeb&lt;/artifactId&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;version&gt;${globalweb.version}&lt;/version&gt; &lt;type&gt;war&lt;/type&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt; &lt;dependency&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;org.mdeggers&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;IHomeWeb&lt;/artifactId&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;version&gt;${ihome.version}&lt;/version&gt; &lt;type&gt;pom&lt;/type&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt; &lt;dependency&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;org.mdeggers&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;IFCResources&lt;/artifactId&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;version&gt;1.0-SNAPSHOT&lt;/version&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;/dependencies&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; There could be as many as 50 components going into the final&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; WAR file, so it would be nice to manage them in a more&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; organized fashion (as well as reduce the clutter in&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; WEB-INF/lib).&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; All of the versions with properties have properties defined.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; The last dependency is the shaded JAR, and the one that is&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; not behaving as expected (but probably as built /&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; configured).&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; The NetBeans graphical display of the dependencies shows &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; IFCResources, as well as the three components it was shaded&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; from.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Sorry for the top-post. It seems to be the norm on this&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; list, whereas the Tomcat mailing list explicitly mentions&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; replying at the bottom. I didn't see any mention of posting&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; style on the site. If posting at the bottom is the encouraged&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; form, I'll be happy to do so.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; . . . just my two cents /mde/&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On 12/4/2014 8:41 PM, Ron Wheeler wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; We do this all the time and it always works. &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; http://blog.artifact-software.com/tech/?p=121&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Aggregation jars make development simpler and wars&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; smaller&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Partial dependencies for &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; org.mdeggers:iforeclosure:1.0-SNAPSHOT:war&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;dependencies&gt; &lt;dependency&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;org.mdeggers&lt;/groupId&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;IFCResources&lt;/artifactId&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;version&gt;1.0-SNAPSHOT&lt;/version&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;/dependencies&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; What are the dependencies for the war file? Partial&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; list is not much help.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Ron&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On 04/12/2014 6:29 PM, Mark Eggers wrote: Folks,&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; I admit it, I'm a bit confused (and relatively new to &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; maven).&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Goal:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; To release a WAR file with a minimal number of JAR&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; files in WEB-INF/lib.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Thought:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; 1. Break up the WAR project into a WAR module and a&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; JAR module 2. Make the WAR module be dependent on the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; JAR module 3. Use the Maven shade plugin in the JAR&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; module to create a shaded JAR 4. Drive the entire&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; project with an agregator pom.xml&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; The JAR module does shade properly, creating a single&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; JAR with all of the dependencies bundled into a single&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; JAR. It uses a pom dependency to gather in most of its&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; requirements. None of the JAR or pom dependencies have&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; further dependencies, so the resulting JAR is&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; self-contained.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; However, when I build the WAR file and reference the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; shaded JAR file as a dependency, I do not get the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; shaded JAR file in WEB-INF/lib. Instead, I get all of&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; the dependencies as individual JAR files in&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; WEB-INF/lib.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; I'm using the following environment (can post my&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; complete pom.xml files if needed).&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; OS:    Fedora Linux 64 bit - latest updates JDK:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; 1.7.0_72 64 bit Maven: 3.2.3&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; maven-shade-plugin: 2.3 maven-war-plugin:   2.4&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; contents:- Hi,&#010;You can copy it to any directory of choice.&#010;One thing to remember is to run it in the validate phase:&#010;mvn validate install ....&#010;&#010;More info here&#010;http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-antrun-plugin/usage.html&#010;Good luck &amp; Shalom!!&#010;Yaron&#010;&#010;On Fri, Dec 5, 2014 at 6:06 PM, Aitor Iturriondobeitia &lt;&#010;laudio.info@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Thanks&#010;&gt; I must copy the file to one dir out of the project. Name  :- Stephen Connolly &lt;stephen.alan.conno...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: First copy one file, befo re anything
contents:- On Friday, December 5, 2014, Yaron Goldstein &lt;yarongoldstein10@gmail.com&gt;&#010;wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt; You can copy it to any directory of choice.&#010;&gt; One thing to remember is to run it in the validate phase:&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;Doing so well up to this point&#010;&#010;&#010;&gt; mvn validate install ....&#010;&#010;&#010;And then shows lack of understanding of maven's lifecycle.&#010;&#010;`validate` is the second phase in the standard lifecycle and `install` is&#010;the second last phase in the standard lifecycle.&#010;&#010;Typing `mvn validate install` will ask maven to run all the phases of the&#010;standard lifecycle up to and including the `validate` phase *and then* run&#010;all the phases of the standard lifecycle up to and including the `install`&#010;phase.&#010;&#010;If you are paying attention you will notice that the above command would&#010;execute the plugins bound to the `validate` phase twice&#010;&#010;There is also some subtlety around how that will behave in a multi-module&#010;reactor... The first validate will be applied to *all* modules *and then*&#010;the second validate will be applied to all modules again... Essentially&#010;processing the reactor twice&#010;&#010;Finally, if you really understand maven you probably should be using the&#010;`verify` phase in examples rather than continuing the habit of polluting&#010;the local repo cache with the `install` phase (though some IDEs and&#010;sub-module workflows need it... A build is better if it will work from a&#010;clean repo with just `mvn verify`)&#010;&#010;&#010;&gt; More info here&#010;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-antrun-plugin/usage.html&#010;&gt; Good luck &amp; Shalom!!&#010;&gt; Yaron&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Fri, Dec 5, 2014 at 6:06 PM, Aitor Iturriondobeitia &lt;&#010;&gt; laudio.info@gmail.com &lt;javascript:;&gt;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Thanks&#010;&gt; &gt; I must copy the file to one dir out of the project. The file is Info the&#010;&gt; &gt; project  ($project.base}/Filters and i must to move to c:/Filters&#010;&gt; &gt; Thanks&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; El viernes, 5 de diciembre de 2014, Yaron Goldstein &lt;&#010;&gt; &gt; yarongoldstein10@gmail.com &lt;javascript:;&gt;&gt; escribió:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Hi.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; Use the ant plugin. Here's an example:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;build&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-antrun-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;executions&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;           &lt;execution&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;phase&gt;validate&lt;/phase&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;goals&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;goal&gt;run&lt;/goal&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;/goals&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;tasks&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;delete file="src/main/resources/config.properties" /&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;copy file="src/main/resources/gold/config.properties"&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; tofile="src/main/resources/config.properties" /&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;delete file="src/main/resources/TestData.properties" /&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &lt;copy file="srcץץץץץ&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; Thanks,&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; Yaron&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; בתאריך 5 בדצמ' 2014 17:13, "Aitor Iturriondobeitia" &lt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; laudio.info@gmail.com &lt;javascript:;&gt;&gt; כתב:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; hello&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; I must to copy one file before anything,&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; This file contains some properties for filtering&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; What plugin must i use and how for moving one file to one directory?&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Thanks&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Sent from my phone&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Andrew Hulbert &lt;ahulb...@ccri.com&gt;
Subject  :-Is there a way to force lightweight http client in settings.xml?
contents:- Hi,&#010;&#010;I've been looking around for a way force usage of the http lightweight &#010;client for Wagon using maven 3.2.3&#010;&#010;I've tried a few options like this:&#010;mvn -Dmaven.wagon.provider.http=lightweight&#010;&#010;or the servers block:&#010;    &lt;servers&gt;&#010;     &lt;server&gt;&#010;       &lt;id&gt;geomesa&lt;/id&gt;&#010;       &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&lt;wagonProvider&gt;org.apache.maven.wagon.providers.http.LightweightHttpWagon&lt;/wagonProvider&gt;&#010;       &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;     &lt;/server&gt;&#010;   &lt;/servers&gt;&#010;&#010;But it seems the only way I can get it to actually work is by removing &#010;the jar for the httpclient implementation from the lib folder.&#010;&#010;Is there a programmatic way to do this in the settings.xml ?&#010;&#010;FYI...the basic issue *appears* to be some TLS SNI issue...using openssl &#010;s_client with the -servername option versus s_client without it fixes &#010;the issues when I'm connecting to the repository.&#010;&#010;Thanks!&#010;&#010;Andrew Hulbert&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Eduard Moraru &lt;enygma2...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Using the Maven Indexer
contents:- Hi,&#010;&#010;I have a new challenge for your maven-indexer expertise :)&#010;&#010;What about adding additional information to the local index? I see the&#010;default indexers (min, etc..) produce really minimal information. The&#010;problem is that everybody is using these default indexers and all the&#010;available indexes (maven central, etc) offer very little information that&#010;you can actually use to make the index useful in an application outside of&#010;really basic name, description, group, artifact, etc queries.&#010;&#010;For instance, if I would want to add author information (to query by&#010;author) or dependency information (to perform compatibility checks against&#010;an installation/group of installed artifacts) or anything else for the&#010;matter, what would be the recommended approach?&#010;&#010;&gt;From what I have currently researched, I see 2 options:&#010;&#010;1) Have a custom IndexCreator that uses the updateDocument(ArtifactInfo&#010;artifactInfo, Document document) method to fetch (HTTP GET) get the pom.xml&#010;by using information from the artifactInfo object (repository, groupID,&#010;artifactId, classifier, version, etc.) so that the resulting document&#010;contains the extra information. It seems that IndexCreators are used a lot&#010;more than they are advertised in the descriptions, not only for indexing&#010;new items, but also when converting between ArtifactInfo objects and Lucene&#010;Documents.&#010;&#010;1.1) I had initially started going on this pat, but then I realized that&#010;the artifactInfo that I receive in this method does not provide basic&#010;information (i.e. artifactInfo.getRepository() always returns null ;-( ) It&#010;would be awesome if information like context and/or repository would be&#010;added to the artifactInfo object (maybe in&#010;IndexUtils.constructArtifactInfo( Document doc, IndexingContext context )&#010;?), the same way the ArtifactInfo.UINFO and ArtifactInfo.LAST_MODIFIED&#010;fields are handled specially and explicitly added to a new Document that is&#010;passed to the IndexCreators.&#010;&#010;2) Handle this separately from maven indexer's work, and do it right after&#010;index/update operations, i.e. let maven-indexer update the local index with&#010;information from the remote index and then start manipulating the&#010;underlying Lucene index by adding information retrieved from the network&#010;(HTTP GET) from the remote repositoy's POM files. In a rough pseudocode,&#010;something like:&#010;&#010;indexer.update(repoX);&#010;indexer.getAllIndexedArtifacts().forEach(artifact -&gt;&#010;  var extraData = getExtraData(repoX, artifact);&#010;  var indexer.getLuceneIndex().add(artifact, extraData)&#010;);&#010;&#010;3) Any other suggestions?&#010;&#010;My ultimate goal is (besides basic name/description queries) to be able to&#010;perform compatibility queries on artifacts coming from multiple&#010;repositories, so I need to find a solution to add this missing infrmation&#010;(artifact dependencies, and maybe more).&#010;&#010;As previously, your help and suggestions are most welcomed.&#010;&#010;Thanks,&#010;Eduard&#010;&#010;On Wed, Nov 26, 2014 at 1:22 PM, Eduard Moraru &lt;enygma2002@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Tue, Nov 25, 2014 at 12:22 PM, Tamas Cservenak &lt;tamas@cservenak.net&gt;&#010;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Hi there,&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 1) yes, indexing context retains the artefact “origin” (ie. repo), so you&#010;&gt;&gt; need context per origin. Sadly, the 1 index per context is current&#010;&gt;&gt; limitation of maven indexer, but this problem is known. Created&#010;&gt;&gt; http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MINDEXER-93&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 2) Yes, merged context is basically delegating to member contexts. under&#010;&gt;&gt; the hud, it uses Lucene’s MultiReader to actually perform the search.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I have solved the search problem for now by using the SearchEngine&#010;&gt; component and issuing an IteratorSearchRequest on a list of&#010;&gt; IndexingContexts to get paginated results. Will have to see how that works&#010;&gt; on the long run.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Thanks,&#010;&gt; Eduard&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Re ranging, there are already issues (or problem spread across multiple&#010;&gt;&gt; issues), most notably this one&#010;&gt;&gt; http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MINDEXER-8&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 3) I think yes. Currently, indexer is being transitioned from Plexus to&#010;&gt;&gt; JSR330, and as you see in examples, it should work with any container&#010;&gt;&gt; supporting it. re “manually wiring”, in latest releases you might be able&#010;&gt;&gt; to do it, but in older ones probably not, as Plexus supported field&#010;&gt;&gt; injection only, and some of those member was not exposed via getter/setter.&#010;&gt;&gt; See&#010;&gt;&gt; http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MINDEXER-80&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; --&#010;&gt;&gt; Thanks,&#010;&gt;&gt; ~t~&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; On 21 Nov 2014 at 18:08:26, Eduard Moraru (enygma2002@gmail.com) wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I have recently started playing with the maven indexer [1], following the&#010;&gt;&gt; examples [2], and I have some questions (since AFAIS, documentation is&#010;&gt;&gt; practically unexistent on the matter):&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 1) From what I can understand, you need an IndexingContext for each&#010;&gt;&gt; repository you plan to index. This makes you end up with n lucene indexes,&#010;&gt;&gt; one for each repository. Is there any way that I could have just 1 lucene&#010;&gt;&gt; index, with all my repositories indexed in the same place? If the main&#010;&gt;&gt; purpose is searchig, why scatter the indexed information across n indexes&#010;&gt;&gt; and make the whole process dificult? Maybe I`m missing something.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 2) On the same line as the first question, when it comes to searching, it&#010;&gt;&gt; seems that I can use a MergedIndexingContext to perform a search on&#010;&gt;&gt; multiple (all) indexed repositories (IndexingContexts). How does this&#010;&gt;&gt; merge&#010;&gt;&gt; the search results? I assume it takes each lucene index and queries it&#010;&gt;&gt; individually, but this probably means that the lucene scores of these&#010;&gt;&gt; merged results are completely messed up and ureliable, right?&#010;&gt;&gt; Any suggestions on how to properly perform search over multiple indexed&#010;&gt;&gt; repositories?&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 3) About the Plexus Container: Am I forced to initialize and use one, or&#010;&gt;&gt; can I/should manually instantiate the default implementations and use them&#010;&gt;&gt; instead?&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I`ll probably come up with more questions along the way, hope someone will&#010;&gt;&gt; find the time to guide me on the right path.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Thanks,&#010;&gt;&gt; Eduard&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; ----------&#010;&gt;&gt; [1] https://github.com/apache/maven-indexer/&#010;&gt;&gt; [2]&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; https://github.com/apache/maven-indexer/tree/master/indexer-examples/indexer-examples-basic&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Eduard Moraru &lt;enygma2...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Using the Maven Indexer
contents:- Hi,&#010;&#010;I have a new challenge for your maven-indexer expertise :)&#010;&#010;What about adding additional information to the local index? I see the&#010;default indexers (min, etc..) produce really minimal information. The&#010;problem is that everybody is using these default indexers and all the&#010;available indexes (maven central, etc) offer very little information that&#010;you can actually use to make the index useful in an application outside of&#010;really basic name, description, group, artifact, etc queries.&#010;&#010;For instance, if I would want to add author information (to query by&#010;author) or dependency information (to perform compatibility checks against&#010;an installation/group of installed artifacts) or anything else for the&#010;matter, what would be the recommended approach?&#010;&#010;&gt;From what I have currently researched, I see 2 options:&#010;&#010;1) Have a custom IndexCreator that uses the updateDocument(ArtifactInfo&#010;artifactInfo, Document document) method to fetch (HTTP GET) get the pom.xml&#010;by using information from the artifactInfo object (repository, groupID,&#010;artifactId, classifier, version, etc.) so that the resulting document&#010;contains the extra information. It seems that IndexCreators are used a lot&#010;more than they are advertised in the descriptions, not only for indexing&#010;new items, but also when converting between ArtifactInfo objects and Lucene&#010;Documents.&#010;&#010;1.1) I had initially started going on this pat, but then I realized that&#010;the artifactInfo that I receive in this method does not provide basic&#010;information (i.e. artifactInfo.getRepository() always returns null ;-( ) It&#010;would be awesome if information like context and/or repository would be&#010;added to the artifactInfo object (maybe in&#010;IndexUtils.constructArtifactInfo( Document doc, IndexingContext context )&#010;?), the same way the ArtifactInfo.UINFO and ArtifactInfo.LAST_MODIFIED&#010;fields are handled specially and explicitly added to a new Document that is&#010;passed to the IndexCreators.&#010;&#010;2) Handle this separately from maven indexer's work, and do it right after&#010;index/update operations, i.e. let maven-indexer update the local index with&#010;information from the remote index and then start manipulating the&#010;underlying Lucene index by adding information retrieved from the network&#010;(HTTP GET) from the remote repositoy's POM files. In a rough pseudocode,&#010;something like:&#010;&#010;indexer.update(repoX);&#010;indexer.getAllIndexedArtifacts().forEach(artifact -&gt;&#010;  var extraData = getExtraData(repoX, artifact);&#010;  var indexer.getLuceneIndex().add(artifact, extraData)&#010;);&#010;&#010;3) Any other suggestions?&#010;&#010;My ultimate goal is (besides basic name/description queries) to be able to&#010;perform compatibility queries on artifacts coming from multiple&#010;repositories, so I need to find a solution to add this missing infrmation&#010;(artifact dependencies, and maybe more).&#010;&#010;As previously, your help and suggestions are most welcomed.&#010;&#010;Thanks,&#010;Eduard&#010;&#010;On Wed, Nov 26, 2014 at 1:22 PM, Eduard Moraru &lt;enygma2002@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Tue, Nov 25, 2014 at 12:22 PM, Tamas Cservenak &lt;tamas@cservenak.net&gt;&#010;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Hi there,&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 1) yes, indexing context retains the artefact “origin” (ie. repo), so you&#010;&gt;&gt; need context per origin. Sadly, the 1 index per context is current&#010;&gt;&gt; limitation of maven indexer, but this problem is known. Created&#010;&gt;&gt; http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MINDEXER-93&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 2) Yes, merged context is basically delegating to member contexts. under&#010;&gt;&gt; the hud, it uses Lucene’s MultiReader to actually perform the search.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I have solved the search problem for now by using the SearchEngine&#010;&gt; component and issuing an IteratorSearchRequest on a list of&#010;&gt; IndexingContexts to get paginated results. Will have to see how that works&#010;&gt; on the long run.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Thanks,&#010;&gt; Eduard&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Re ranging, there are already issues (or problem spread across multiple&#010;&gt;&gt; issues), most notably this one&#010;&gt;&gt; http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MINDEXER-8&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 3) I think yes. Currently, indexer is being transitioned from Plexus to&#010;&gt;&gt; JSR330, and as you see in examples, it should work with any container&#010;&gt;&gt; supporting it. re “manually wiring”, in latest releases you might be able&#010;&gt;&gt; to do it, but in older ones probably not, as Plexus supported field&#010;&gt;&gt; injection only, and some of those member was not exposed via getter/setter.&#010;&gt;&gt; See&#010;&gt;&gt; http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MINDEXER-80&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; --&#010;&gt;&gt; Thanks,&#010;&gt;&gt; ~t~&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; On 21 Nov 2014 at 18:08:26, Eduard Moraru (enygma2002@gmail.com) wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I have recently started playing with the maven indexer [1], following the&#010;&gt;&gt; examples [2], and I have some questions (since AFAIS, documentation is&#010;&gt;&gt; practically unexistent on the matter):&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 1) From what I can understand, you need an IndexingContext for each&#010;&gt;&gt; repository you plan to index. This makes you end up with n lucene indexes,&#010;&gt;&gt; one for each repository. Is there any way that I could have just 1 lucene&#010;&gt;&gt; index, with all my repositories indexed in the same place? If the main&#010;&gt;&gt; purpose is searchig, why scatter the indexed information across n indexes&#010;&gt;&gt; and make the whole process dificult? Maybe I`m missing something.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 2) On the same line as the first question, when it comes to searching, it&#010;&gt;&gt; seems that I can use a MergedIndexingContext to perform a search on&#010;&gt;&gt; multiple (all) indexed repositories (IndexingContexts). How does this&#010;&gt;&gt; merge&#010;&gt;&gt; the search results? I assume it takes each lucene index and queries it&#010;&gt;&gt; individually, but this probably means that the lucene scores of these&#010;&gt;&gt; merged results are completely messed up and ureliable, right?&#010;&gt;&gt; Any suggestions on how to properly perform search over multiple indexed&#010;&gt;&gt; repositories?&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; 3) About the Plexus Container: Am I forced to initialize and use one, or&#010;&gt;&gt; can I/should manually instantiate the default implementations and use them&#010;&gt;&gt; instead?&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I`ll probably come up with more questions along the way, hope someone will&#010;&gt;&gt; find the time to guide me on the right path.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Thanks,&#010;&gt;&gt; Eduard&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; ----------&#010;&gt;&gt; [1] https://github.com/apache/maven-indexer/&#010;&gt;&gt; [2]&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; https://github.com/apache/maven-indexer/tree/master/indexer-examples/indexer-examples-basic&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Tamas Cservenak &lt;ta...@cservenak.net&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Using the Maven Indexer
contents:- Hi Eduard,&#010;&#010;for additional information see:&#010;http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MINDEXER-81&#010;&#010;Currently, the ArtifactInfo is hardwired, is not extensible.&#010;&#010;Re available index for Central, it’s not the “minimal usable” &#010;the decision driver, but the SIZE of the index download instead.&#010;We were experimenting with different creators, but the bandwidth&#010;it took off (if you compared it to artifact downloads) was really huge.&#010;&#010;As almost everyone uses MRMs, and they tend to “improve” the&#010;basic GAV index Central publishes (ie. once Nexus caches a &#010;JAR file, it will “improve” the index with Classnames in the JAR too,&#010;something Central does not publish).&#010;&#010;artifactInfo#repoId should not return null, if asked via context.&#010;If it does, there is a bug lurking somewhere.&#010;&#010;Currently the “extra info” path is viable, but that would create a lot&#010;of cruft around indexer classes…..&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Thanks,&#010;~t~&#010;&#010;On 8 Dec 2014 at 17:15:08, Eduard Moraru (enygma2002@gmail.com) wrote:&#010;&#010;Hi,  &#010;&#010;I have a new challenge for your maven-indexer expertise :)  &#010;&#010;What about adding additional information to the local index? I see the  &#010;default indexers (min, etc..) produce really minimal information. The  &#010;problem is that everybody is using these default indexers and all the  &#010;available indexes (maven central, etc) offer very little information that  &#010;you can actually use to make the index useful in an application outside of  &#010;really basic name, description, group, artifact, etc queries.  &#010;&#010;For instance, if I would want to add author information (to query by  &#010;author) or dependency information (to perform compatibility checks against  &#010;an installation/group of installed artifacts) or anything else for the  &#010;matter, what would be the recommended approach?  &#010;&#010;From what I have currently researched, I see 2 options:  &#010;&#010;1) Have a custom IndexCreator that uses the updateDocument(ArtifactInfo  &#010;artifactInfo, Document document) method to fetch (HTTP GET) get the pom.xml  &#010;by using information from the artifactInfo object (repository, groupID,  &#010;artifactId, classifier, version, etc.) so that the resulting document  &#010;contains the extra information. It seems that IndexCreators are used a lot  &#010;more than they are advertised in the descriptions, not only for indexing  &#010;new items, but also when converting between ArtifactInfo objects and Lucene  &#010;Documents.  &#010;&#010;1.1) I had initially started going on this pat, but then I realized that  &#010;the artifactInfo that I receive in this method does not provide basic  &#010;information (i.e. artifactInfo.getRepository() always returns null ;-( ) It  &#010;would be awesome if information like context and/or repository would be  &#010;added to the artifactInfo object (maybe in  &#010;IndexUtils.constructArtifactInfo( Document doc, IndexingContext context )  &#010;?), the same way the ArtifactInfo.UINFO and ArtifactInfo.LAST_MODIFIED  &#010;fields are handled specially and explicitly added to a new Document that is  &#010;passed to the IndexCreators.  &#010;&#010;2) Handle this separately from maven indexer's work, and do it right after  &#010;index/update operations, i.e. let maven-indexer update the local index with  &#010;information from the remote index and then start manipulating the  &#010;underlying Lucene index by adding information retrieved from the network  &#010;(HTTP GET) from the remote repositoy's POM files. In a rough pseudocode,  &#010;something like:  &#010;&#010;indexer.update(repoX);  &#010;indexer.getAllIndexedArtifacts().forEach(artifact -&gt;  &#010;var extraData = getExtraData(repoX, artifact);  &#010;var indexer.getLuceneIndex().add(artifact, extraData)  &#010;);  &#010;&#010;3) Any other suggestions?  &#010;&#010;My ultimate goal is (besides basic name/description queries) to be able to  &#010;perform compatibility queries on artifacts coming from multiple  &#010;repositories, so I need to find a solution to add this missing infrmation  &#010;(artifact dependencies, and maybe more).  &#010;&#010;As previously, your help and suggestions are most welcomed.  &#010;&#010;Thanks,  &#010;Eduard  &#010;&#010;On Wed, Nov 26, 2014 at 1:22 PM, Eduard Moraru &lt;enygma2002@gmail.com&gt; wrote:  &#010;&#010;&gt;  &#010;&gt;  &#010;&gt; On Tue, Nov 25, 2014 at 12:22 PM, Tamas Cservenak &lt;tamas@cservenak.net&gt;  &#010;&gt; wrote:  &#010;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; Hi there,  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; 1) yes, indexing context retains the artefact “origin” (ie. repo), so you  &#010;&gt;&gt; need context per origin. Sadly, the 1 index per context is current  &#010;&gt;&gt; limitation of maven indexer, but this problem is known. Created  &#010;&gt;&gt; http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MINDEXER-93  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; 2) Yes, merged context is basically delegating to member contexts. under  &#010;&gt;&gt; the hud, it uses Lucene’s MultiReader to actually perform the search.  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;  &#010;&gt; I have solved the search problem for now by using the SearchEngine  &#010;&gt; component and issuing an IteratorSearchRequest on a list of  &#010;&gt; IndexingContexts to get paginated results. Will have to see how that works  &#010;&gt; on the long run.  &#010;&gt;  &#010;&gt; Thanks,  &#010;&gt; Eduard  &#010;&gt;  &#010;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; Re ranging, there are already issues (or problem spread across multiple  &#010;&gt;&gt; issues), most notably this one  &#010;&gt;&gt; http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MINDEXER-8  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; 3) I think yes. Currently, indexer is being transitioned from Plexus to  &#010;&gt;&gt; JSR330, and as you see in examples, it should work with any container  &#010;&gt;&gt; supporting it. re “manually wiring”, in latest releases you might be able  &#010;&gt;&gt; to do it, but in older ones probably not, as Plexus supported field  &#010;&gt;&gt; injection only, and some of those member was not exposed via getter/setter.  &#010;&gt;&gt; See  &#010;&gt;&gt; http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MINDEXER-80  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; --  &#010;&gt;&gt; Thanks,  &#010;&gt;&gt; ~t~  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; On 21 Nov 2014 at 18:08:26, Eduard Moraru (enygma2002@gmail.com) wrote:  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; Hi,  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; I have recently started playing with the maven indexer [1], following the  &#010;&gt;&gt; examples [2], and I have some questions (since AFAIS, documentation is  &#010;&gt;&gt; practically unexistent on the matter):  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; 1) From what I can understand, you need an IndexingContext for each  &#010;&gt;&gt; repository you plan to index. This makes you end up with n lucene indexes,  &#010;&gt;&gt; one for each repository. Is there any way that I could have just 1 lucene  &#010;&gt;&gt; index, with all my repositories indexed in the same place? If the main  &#010;&gt;&gt; purpose is searchig, why scatter the indexed information across n indexes  &#010;&gt;&gt; and make the whole process dificult? Maybe I`m missing something.  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; 2) On the same line as the first question, when it comes to searching, it  &#010;&gt;&gt; seems that I can use a MergedIndexingContext to perform a search on  &#010;&gt;&gt; multiple (all) indexed repositories (IndexingContexts). How does this  &#010;&gt;&gt; merge  &#010;&gt;&gt; the search results? I assume it takes each lucene index and queries it  &#010;&gt;&gt; individually, but this probably means that the lucene scores of these  &#010;&gt;&gt; merged results are completely messed up and ureliable, right?  &#010;&gt;&gt; Any suggestions on how to properly perform search over multiple indexed  &#010;&gt;&gt; repositories?  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; 3) About the Plexus Container: Am I forced to initialize and use one, or  &#010;&gt;&gt; can I/should manually instantiate the default implementations and use them  &#010;&gt;&gt; instead?  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; I`ll probably come up with more questions along the way, hope someone will  &#010;&gt;&gt; find the time to guide me on the right path.  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; Thanks,  &#010;&gt;&gt; Eduard  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; ----------  &#010;&gt;&gt; [1] https://github.com/apache/maven-indexer/  &#010;&gt;&gt; [2]  &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt; https://github.com/apache/maven-indexer/tree/master/indexer-examples/indexer-examples-basic&#010; &#010;&gt;&gt;  &#010;&gt;  &#010;&gt;  &#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- Paul Benedict &lt;pbened...@apache.org&gt;
Subject  :-Exception overlaying zip in war
contents:- I configured the WAR plugin to overlay a zip file. Nothing fancy. Here's&#010;the config:&#010;&#010;&lt;plugin&gt;&#010;  &lt;groupId&gt;org.apache.maven.plugins&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;  &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-war-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;  &lt;version&gt;2.5&lt;/version&gt;&#010;  &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;    &lt;overlays&gt;&#010;      &lt;groupId&gt;org.company&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;      &lt;artifactId&gt;ui&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;      &lt;type&gt;zip&lt;/type&gt;&#010;    &lt;/overlays&gt;&#010;  &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;&lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&#010;I get an exception:&#010;java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.String cannot be&#010;cast to org.apache.maven.plugin.war.Overlay&#010;at&#010;org.apache.maven.plugin.war.overlay.OverlayManager.initialize(OverlayManager.java:122)&#010;&#010;I looked at the WAR source. I don't know how a String is making it into the&#010;List&lt;Overlay&gt; collection. Any WAR developers here?&#010;&#010;Cheers,&#010;Paul&#010;&#010;

Name  :- David Hoffer &lt;dhoff...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Maven 3.2.3 upgrade
contents:- I'm contemplating an upgrade of a large Maven 3.0.4 build to 3.2.3, just&#010;wondering if anyone knows of either any key gotchas in the upgrade and/or&#010;key benefits?&#010;&#010;One feature I'm wondering at the outset is...with 3.2.3 can I specify the&#010;reporting plugin versions in pluginManagement or does this still need to be&#010;done manually?&#010;&#010;-Dave&#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- Hervé BOUTEMY &lt;herve.bout...@free.fr&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven 3.2.3 upgrade
contents:- Le lundi 8 décembre 2014 13:01:10 David Hoffer a écrit :&#010;&gt; I'm contemplating an upgrade of a large Maven 3.0.4 build to 3.2.3, just&#010;&gt; wondering if anyone knows of either any key gotchas in the upgrade and/or&#010;&gt; key benefits?&#010;you should check compatibility issues known with some plugins:&#010;https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/AetherClassNotFound&#010;&#010;some are fixed if you're using recent version of the affected plugins, some are &#010;not yet fixed&#010;&#010;&#010;for the benefits, choose your favorite from release notes&#010;http://maven.apache.org/release-notes-all.html&#010;&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; One feature I'm wondering at the outset is...with 3.2.3 can I specify the&#010;&gt; reporting plugin versions in pluginManagement or does this still need to be&#010;&gt; done manually?&#010;see https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MNG-5477&#010;so changing Maven version is just about avoiding a misleading warning&#010;What is important is maven-site-plugin version.&#010;&#010;And see https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MSITE-516&#010;maven-site-plugin version 3.4 has major improvement regarding pluginManagement&#010;&#010;Regards,&#010;&#010;Hervé&#010;&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; -Dave&#010;&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- David Hoffer &lt;dhoff...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven 3.2.3 upgrade
contents:- One other issue came up in this upgrade.  We still have branches that have&#010;to stay at 3.0.x.  How can I make the trunk build use 3.2.3 w/o changing&#010;everyone's M2_HOME?  Is there a way to bootstrap the build so the build&#010;picks the specified version of Maven?  E.g. I want the build to specify the&#010;version used not the system.&#010;&#010;-Dave&#010;&#010;On Mon, Dec 8, 2014 at 2:41 PM, Hervé BOUTEMY &lt;herve.boutemy@free.fr&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Le lundi 8 décembre 2014 13:01:10 David Hoffer a écrit :&#010;&gt; &gt; I'm contemplating an upgrade of a large Maven 3.0.4 build to 3.2.3, just&#010;&gt; &gt; wondering if anyone knows of either any key gotchas in the upgrade and/or&#010;&gt; &gt; key benefits?&#010;&gt; you should check compatibility issues known with some plugins:&#010;&gt; https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/AetherClassNotFound&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; some are fixed if you're using recent version of the affected plugins,&#010;&gt; some are&#010;&gt; not yet fixed&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; for the benefits, choose your favorite from release notes&#010;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/release-notes-all.html&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; One feature I'm wondering at the outset is...with 3.2.3 can I specify the&#010;&gt; &gt; reporting plugin versions in pluginManagement or does this still need to&#010;&gt; be&#010;&gt; &gt; done manually?&#010;&gt; see https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MNG-5477&#010;&gt; so changing Maven version is just about avoiding a misleading warning&#010;&gt; What is important is maven-site-plugin version.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; And see https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MSITE-516&#010;&gt; maven-site-plugin version 3.4 has major improvement regarding&#010;&gt; pluginManagement&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Regards,&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Hervé&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; -Dave&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Jörg Schaible &lt;joerg.schai...@swisspost.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven 3.2.3 upgrade
contents:- Hi Dave,&#010;&#010;David Hoffer wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; One other issue came up in this upgrade.  We still have branches that have&#010;&gt; to stay at 3.0.x.  How can I make the trunk build use 3.2.3 w/o changing&#010;&gt; everyone's M2_HOME?  Is there a way to bootstrap the build so the build&#010;&gt; picks the specified version of Maven?  E.g. I want the build to specify&#010;&gt; the version used not the system.&#010;&#010;Don't set it at all. The mvn shell scripts will automatically do so for &#010;their Maven version on-the-fly.&#010;&#010;Cheers,&#010;Jörg&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Bernd Eckenfels &lt;e...@zusammenkunft.net&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven 3.2.3 upgrade
contents:- Am Tue, 09 Dec 2014 09:27:29 +0100&#010;schrieb Jörg Schaible &lt;joerg.schaible@swisspost.com&gt;:&#010;&#010;&gt; &gt; One other issue came up in this upgrade.  We still have branches&#010;&gt; &gt; that have to stay at 3.0.x.  How can I make the trunk build use&#010;&gt; &gt; 3.2.3 w/o changing everyone's M2_HOME?  Is there a way to bootstrap&#010;&gt; &gt; the build so the build picks the specified version of Maven?  E.g.&#010;&gt; &gt; I want the build to specify the version used not the system.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Don't set it at all. The mvn shell scripts will automatically do so&#010;&gt; for their Maven version on-the-fly.&#010;&#010;and use a CI Server where you configure the maven path for each job.&#010;&#010;Gruss&#010;Bernd&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- David Hoffer &lt;dhoff...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven 3.2.3 upgrade
contents:- I don't think the CI Server is an issue as we have lots of flexibility when&#010;we setup those jobs.  The issue is for developer builds.  I'm not clear how&#010;to setup workstations to make it easy to build projects with different&#010;Maven versions.&#010;&#010;Our standard practice is to set M2_HOME to the maven install and then add&#010;%M2_HOME%/bin to the path.&#010;&#010;The suggestion was to not set M2_HOME...okay I thought that was required&#010;but we can not set it.  We still need Maven in our path.  Are you saying&#010;that if I set the path to Maven version X, my build can somehow specify to&#010;use Maven version Y or Z?  All I've seen in Maven thus far is the ability&#010;to specify what version must be used not what version to use, and it's the&#010;later I'm looking for.  I don't want devs to have to reconfigure their&#010;system props to build different code branches.&#010;&#010;-Dave&#010;&#010;On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 1:51 AM, Bernd Eckenfels &lt;ecki@zusammenkunft.net&gt;&#010;wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Am Tue, 09 Dec 2014 09:27:29 +0100&#010;&gt; schrieb Jörg Schaible &lt;joerg.schaible@swisspost.com&gt;:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; One other issue came up in this upgrade.  We still have branches&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; that have to stay at 3.0.x.  How can I make the trunk build use&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; 3.2.3 w/o changing everyone's M2_HOME?  Is there a way to bootstrap&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; the build so the build picks the specified version of Maven?  E.g.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; I want the build to specify the version used not the system.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Don't set it at all. The mvn shell scripts will automatically do so&#010;&gt; &gt; for their Maven version on-the-fly.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; and use a CI Server where you configure the maven path for each job.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Gruss&#010;&gt; Bernd&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- Adrien Rivard &lt;adrien.riv...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven 3.2.3 upgrade
contents:- Have them execute a wrapper script that set Maven paths according to the&#010;current project and execute it.&#010;you can even alias this script to "mvn" command.&#010;&#010;&#010;On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 4:12 PM, David Hoffer &lt;dhoffer6@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; I don't think the CI Server is an issue as we have lots of flexibility when&#010;&gt; we setup those jobs.  The issue is for developer builds.  I'm not clear how&#010;&gt; to setup workstations to make it easy to build projects with different&#010;&gt; Maven versions.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Our standard practice is to set M2_HOME to the maven install and then add&#010;&gt; %M2_HOME%/bin to the path.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; The suggestion was to not set M2_HOME...okay I thought that was required&#010;&gt; but we can not set it.  We still need Maven in our path.  Are you saying&#010;&gt; that if I set the path to Maven version X, my build can somehow specify to&#010;&gt; use Maven version Y or Z?  All I've seen in Maven thus far is the ability&#010;&gt; to specify what version must be used not what version to use, and it's the&#010;&gt; later I'm looking for.  I don't want devs to have to reconfigure their&#010;&gt; system props to build different code branches.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; -Dave&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 1:51 AM, Bernd Eckenfels &lt;ecki@zusammenkunft.net&gt;&#010;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Am Tue, 09 Dec 2014 09:27:29 +0100&#010;&gt; &gt; schrieb Jörg Schaible &lt;joerg.schaible@swisspost.com&gt;:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; One other issue came up in this upgrade.  We still have branches&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; that have to stay at 3.0.x.  How can I make the trunk build use&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; 3.2.3 w/o changing everyone's M2_HOME?  Is there a way to bootstrap&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; the build so the build picks the specified version of Maven?  E.g.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; I want the build to specify the version used not the system.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Don't set it at all. The mvn shell scripts will automatically do so&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; for their Maven version on-the-fly.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; and use a CI Server where you configure the maven path for each job.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Gruss&#010;&gt; &gt; Bernd&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; &gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Adrien Rivard&#010;&#010;

Name  :- David Hoffer &lt;dhoff...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven 3.2.3 upgrade
contents:- In our case devs will be in active development in both branches so&#010;potentially building both at the same time.  So it seems I either have to&#010;upgrade both to 3.2.3 or make the old one at least work with 3.2.3 or don't&#010;upgrade at all.&#010;&#010;Maven really needs a bootstrap process where the build specifies the&#010;version used so multiple builds can co-exist using any maven version, is&#010;that a planned feature?&#010;&#010;-Dave&#010;&#010;On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 8:25 AM, Adrien Rivard &lt;adrien.rivard@gmail.com&gt;&#010;wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Have them execute a wrapper script that set Maven paths according to the&#010;&gt; current project and execute it.&#010;&gt; you can even alias this script to "mvn" command.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 4:12 PM, David Hoffer &lt;dhoffer6@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; I don't think the CI Server is an issue as we have lots of flexibility&#010;&gt; when&#010;&gt; &gt; we setup those jobs. We still need Maven in our path.  Are you saying&#010;&gt; &gt; that if I set the path to Maven version X, my build can somehow specify&#010;&gt; to&#010;&gt; &gt; use Maven version Y or Z?  All I've seen in Maven thus far is the ability&#010;&gt; &gt; to specify what version must be used not what version to use, and it's&#010;&gt; the&#010;&gt; &gt; later I'm looking for.  I don't want devs to have to reconfigure their&#010;&gt; &gt; system props to build different code branches.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; -Dave&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 1:51 AM, Bernd Eckenfels &lt;ecki@zusammenkunft.net&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Am Tue, 09 Dec 2014 09:27:29 +0100&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; schrieb Jörg Schaible &lt;joerg.schaible@swisspost.com&gt;:&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; One other issue came up in this upgrade. Name  :- Stephen Connolly &lt;stephen.alan.conno...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven 3.2.3 upgrade
contents:- I normally use a script similar to this:&#010;http://javaadventure.blogspot.ie/search?q=usemvn&#010;&#010;That lets me switch the active maven version for each shell quickly.&#010;&#010;You can then set an enforcer rule that prevents the wrong one if you want&#010;to force a specific maven and people can quickly switch with just one&#010;command&#010;&#010;On 9 December 2014 at 15:43, David Hoffer &lt;dhoffer6@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; In our case devs will be in active development in both branches so&#010;&gt; potentially building both at the same time.  So it seems I either have to&#010;&gt; upgrade both to 3.2.3 or make the old one at least work with 3.2.3 or don't&#010;&gt; upgrade at all.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Maven really needs a bootstrap process where the build specifies the&#010;&gt; version used so multiple builds can co-exist using any maven version, is&#010;&gt; that a planned feature?&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; -Dave&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 8:25 AM, Adrien Rivard &lt;adrien.rivard@gmail.com&gt;&#010;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Have them execute a wrapper script that set Maven paths according to the&#010;&gt; &gt; current project and execute it.&#010;&gt; &gt; you can even alias this script to "mvn" command.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 4:12 PM, David Hoffer &lt;dhoffer6@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; I don't think the CI Server is an issue as we have lots of flexibility&#010;&gt; &gt; when&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; we setup those jobs.  The issue is for developer builds.  I'm not clear&#010;&gt; &gt; how&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; to setup workstations to make it easy to build projects with different&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Maven versions.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Our standard practice is to set M2_HOME to the maven install and then&#010;&gt; add&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; %M2_HOME%/bin to the path.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; The suggestion was to not set M2_HOME...okay I thought that was&#010;&gt; required&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; but we can not set it.  We still need Maven in our path.  Are you&#010;&gt; saying&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; that if I set the path to Maven version X, my build can somehow specify&#010;&gt; &gt; to&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; use Maven version Y or Z?  All I've seen in Maven thus far is the&#010;&gt; ability&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; to specify what version must be used not what version to use, and it's&#010;&gt; &gt; the&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; later I'm looking for.  I don't want devs to have to reconfigure their&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; system props to build different code branches.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; -Dave&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 1:51 AM, Bernd Eckenfels &lt;&#010;&gt; ecki@zusammenkunft.net&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; Am Tue, 09 Dec 2014 09:27:29 +0100&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; schrieb Jörg Schaible &lt;joerg.schaible@swisspost.com&gt;:&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; One other issue came up in this upgrade.  We still have branches&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; that have to stay at 3.0.x.  How can I make the trunk build&#010;use&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; 3.2.3 w/o changing everyone's M2_HOME?  Is there a way to&#010;&gt; bootstrap&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; the build so the build picks the specified version of Maven?&#010;&gt; E.g.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; I want the build to specify the version used not the system.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; Don't set it at all. The mvn shell scripts will automatically do&#010;so&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; for their Maven version on-the-fly.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; and use a CI Server where you configure the maven path for each job.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; Gruss&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; Bernd&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; --&#010;&gt; &gt; Adrien Rivard&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Subject  :-Re: Maven 3.2.3 upgrade
contents:- The really adventurous person could re-use the rvm bash trickery and help&#010;us all ;-)&#010;&#010;On 9 December 2014 at 16:01, Stephen Connolly &lt;&#010;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; I normally use a script similar to this:&#010;&gt; http://javaadventure.blogspot.ie/search?q=usemvn&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; That lets me switch the active maven version for each shell quickly.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; You can then set an enforcer rule that prevents the wrong one if you want&#010;&gt; to force a specific maven and people can quickly switch with just one&#010;&gt; command&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On 9 December 2014 at 15:43, David Hoffer &lt;dhoffer6@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; In our case devs will be in active development in both branches so&#010;&gt;&gt; potentially building both at the same time.  So it seems I either have to&#010;&gt;&gt; upgrade both to 3.2.3 or make the old one at least work with 3.2.3 or&#010;&gt;&gt; don't&#010;&gt;&gt; upgrade at all.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Maven really needs a bootstrap process where the build specifies the&#010;&gt;&gt; version used so multiple builds can co-exist using any maven version, is&#010;&gt;&gt; that a planned feature?&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; -Dave&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 8:25 AM, Adrien Rivard &lt;adrien.rivard@gmail.com&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; Have them execute a wrapper script that set Maven paths according to the&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; current project and execute it.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; you can even alias this script to "mvn" command.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 4:12 PM, David Hoffer &lt;dhoffer6@gmail.com&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; I don't think the CI Server is an issue as we have lots of flexibility&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; when&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; we setup those jobs.  The issue is for developer builds.  I'm not&#010;&gt;&gt; clear&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; how&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; to setup workstations to make it easy to build projects with different&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; Maven versions.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; Our standard practice is to set M2_HOME to the maven install and then&#010;&gt;&gt; add&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; %M2_HOME%/bin to the path.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; The suggestion was to not set M2_HOME...okay I thought that was&#010;&gt;&gt; required&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; but we can not set it.  We still need Maven in our path.  Are you&#010;&gt;&gt; saying&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; that if I set the path to Maven version X, my build can somehow&#010;&gt;&gt; specify&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; to&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; use Maven version Y or Z?  All I've seen in Maven thus far is the&#010;&gt;&gt; ability&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; to specify what version must be used not what version to use, and it's&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; the&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; later I'm looking for.  I don't want devs to have to reconfigure their&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; system props to build different code branches.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; -Dave&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; On Tue, Dec 9, 2014 at 1:51 AM, Bernd Eckenfels &lt;&#010;&gt;&gt; ecki@zusammenkunft.net&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; Am Tue, 09 Dec 2014 09:27:29 +0100&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; schrieb Jörg Schaible &lt;joerg.schaible@swisspost.com&gt;:&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; One other issue came up in this upgrade. Name  :- Tony Chemit &lt;tche...@apache.org&gt;
Subject  :-[ANN] License Maven Plugin 1.8 released
contents:- The Mojo team is pleased to announce the release of the License Maven Plugin, version 1.8.&#010;&#010;&#010;This plugin manages the license of a maven project and its dependencies&#010;(update file headers, download dependencies licenses, check thirdparty&#010;licenses, ...).&#010;&#010;Description&#010;-----------&#010;&#010;This License Plugin has the following goals:&#010;&#010;* license:add-third-party&#010;  Goal to generate the third-party license file. This file contains a list of&#010;  the dependencies and their licenses. Each dependency and it's license is&#010;  displayed on a single line in the format&#010;&#010;   (&lt;license-name&gt;) &lt;project-name&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;:&lt;artifactId&gt;:&lt;version&gt;&#010;-&#010;  &lt;project-url&gt;&#010;  It will also copy it in the class-path (says add the generated directory as a&#010;  resource of the build).&#010;&#010;* license:aggregate-add-third-party&#010;  This aggregator goal (will be executed only once and only on pom projects)&#010;  executed the add-third-party on all his modules (in a parellel build cycle)&#010;  then aggreates all the third-party files in final one in the pom project.&#010;&#010;* license:check-file-header&#010;  The goal to check if the state of header on project source files.&#010;&#010;* license:comment-style-list&#010;  Displays all the available comment style to box file headers.&#010;&#010;* license:download-licenses&#010;  Download the license files of all the current project's dependencies, and&#010;  generate a summary file containing a list of all dependencies and their&#010;  licenses.&#010;&#010;* license:license-list&#010;  Display all available licenses.&#010;&#010;* license:third-party-report&#010;  Generates a report of all third-parties detected in the module.&#010;&#010;* license:update-file-header&#010;  The goal to update (or add) the header on project source files. This goal&#010;  replace the update-header goal which can not deal with Copyright. This goal&#010;  use a specific project file descriptor project.xml to describe all files to&#010;  update for a whole project.&#010;&#010;* license:update-project-license&#010;  Updates (or creates) the main project license file according to the given&#010;  license defines as licenseName. Can also generate a bundled license file (to&#010;  avoid collision names in class-path). This file is by default generated in&#010;  META-INF class-path directory.&#010;&#010;Useful links&#010;------------&#010;&#010;Documentation: http://mojo.codehaus.org/license-maven-plugin&#010;JIRA: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MLICENSE&#010;svn:  https://svn.codehaus.org/mojo/tags/license-maven-plugin-1.8&#010;&#010;To get this update, simply specify the version in your project's plugin&#010;configuration: &#010;&#010;&lt;plugin&gt;&#010;  &lt;groupId&gt;org.codehaus.mojo&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;  &lt;artifactId&gt;license-maven-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;  &lt;version&gt;1.8&lt;/version&gt;&#010;&lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&#010;The artifacts have been deployed to the mojo repository and will be&#010;mirrored to central.&#010;&#010;Release Notes&#010;-------------&#010;&#010;** Bug&#010;    * [MLICENSE-108] - copyright owner is not working properly&#010;    * [MLICENSE-113] - Eclipse Public License includes Eclipse Distribution License by mistake&#010;&#010;Enjoy,&#010;&#010;The Mojo team.&#010;&#010;tony&#010;&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Tony Chemit&#010;--------------------&#010;tél: +33 (0) 2 40 50 29 28&#010;http://www.codelutin.com&#010;email: chemit@codelutin.com&#010;twitter: https://twitter.com/tchemit&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- Tony Chemit &lt;tche...@apache.org&gt;
Subject  :-[ANN] Animal Sniffer 1.13 Released
contents:- Hi,&#010;&#010;The Mojo team is pleased to announce the release of Animal Sniffer version 1.13.&#010;&#010;Animal Sniffer provides tools to assist verifying that classes&#010;compiled with a newer JDK/API are compatible with an older JDK/API.&#010;&#010;The following tools are provided by animal sniffer:&#010;&#010;* A command line tool to dump the class file version number&#010;(http://mojo.codehaus.org/animal-sniffer/animal-sniffer/index.html).&#010;This helps you track down the offending jar file when you see&#010;UnsupportedClassVersionError.&#010;&#010;* A set of ANT tasks&#010;(http://mojo.codehaus.org/animal-sniffer/animal-sniffer-ant-tasks/index.html&#010;)&#010;for verifying that your classes comply with an API signature as well&#010;as tasks for creating API signatures from a JDK, or a collection or&#010;jar and class files, or a collection of other API signature files, or&#010;combination of these elements.&#010;&#010;* A rule for use in the maven-enforcer-plugin&#010;(&#010;http://mojo.codehaus.org/animal-sniffer/animal-sniffer-enforcer-rule/index.html&#010;)&#010;for verifying that your classes comply with an API signature .&#010;&#010;* A maven plugin&#010;(http://mojo.codehaus.org/animal-sniffer-maven-plugin/index.html) for&#010;verifying that your classes comply with an API signature as well as&#010;for creating API signatures from a JDK, or the current module's&#010;classes, or the current module's dependencies, or a collection of&#010;other API signature files, or combination of these elements.&#010;&#010;The artifacts have are available from the Maven Central repository.&#010;&#010;Release Notes - Mojo's Animal Sniffer - Version 1.13&#010;&#010;** New Feature&#010; * [MANIMALSNIFFER-48] - Resolve signature version from dependencies / dependencyManagement&#010;if unspecified&#010;&#010;The Mojo Team.&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Tony Chemit&#010;--------------------&#010;tél: +33 (0) 2 40 50 29 28&#010;http://www.codelutin.com&#010;email: chemit@codelutin.com&#010;twitter: https://twitter.com/tchemit&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- Stephen Connolly &lt;stephen.alan.conno...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-[VOTE] Run-off for mascot's name
contents:- This is a run-off vote to select the top two options for our new mascot's&#010;name.&#010;&#010;The entries with the highest number of votes will be selected for the final&#010;round. If there is only one entry with the highest number of votes then the&#010;entries with the second highest number of votes will also be included in&#010;the final round.&#010;&#010;The vote will be open for 72 hours.&#010;&#010;The entries are as follows:&#010;&#010;A. Abraham&#010;B. Boo&#010;C. Darth Mowl&#010;D. Jacob&#010;E. Kaboom&#010;F. Moses&#010;G. Rap&#010;H. Shotgun&#010;K. The Maven Owl&#010;L. Ty&#010;&#010;It is not clear whether all of the above suggestions were completely&#010;serious, but I have included them anyway for this first round.&#010;&#010;Please respond with at most your top three in order of preference. I may&#010;not use second or third preferences if we get a sufficient number of votes,&#010;but in the case of a small poll the additional preferences will help.&#010;&#010;In the event of repeated votes from an individual, only the last cast vote&#010;as determined by me will count.&#010;&#010;Any other discussion should happen in a separate thread.&#010;&#010;Thanks&#010;&#010;-Stephen&#010;&#010;

Subject  :-Re: [VOTE] Run-off for mascot's name
contents:- After counting the 21 votes cast. I may&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; not use second or third preferences if we get a sufficient number of&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; votes, but in the case of a small poll the additional preferences will&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; help.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; In the event of repeated votes from an individual, only the last cast&#010;&gt; vote&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; as determined by me will count.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; Any other discussion should happen in a separate thread.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; Thanks&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; -Stephen&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; &gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; --&#010;&gt; Vriendelijke groeten,&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Jeroen Hoek&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Lable&#010;&gt; ✉ jeroen@lable.org&#010;&gt; ℡ 088 44 20 202&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://lable.org&#010;&gt; KvK № 55984037&#010;&gt; BTW № NL8519.32.411.B.01&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Adrien Ruffié &lt;adriennolar...@hotmail.fr&gt;
Subject  :-Exclude unit test by parameter
contents:- Hello all,&#010;&#010; &#010;&#010;I Have several test packages, for example com.myapp.test1, com.myapp.test2,&#010;com.myapp.test3&#010;&#010;How I can exclude by parameter one package ? for example:&#010;&#010; &#010;&#010;mvn test DskipTests=com.myapp.test1&#010;&#010;Or&#010;&#010;mvn test Dtest.exclude=com.myapp.test2&#010;&#010; &#010;&#010;I have try both, and no success &#010;&#010; &#010;&#010;Thank and best regards.&#010;&#010; &#010;&#010;Adrien Ruffié&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- &quot;Robert Scholte&quot; &lt;rfscho...@apache.org&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Exclude unit test by parameter
contents:- Please read  &#010;http://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/test-mojo.html#test&#010;&#010;thanks,&#010;Robert&#010;&#010;ps I wonder why you thought the other would work or what/who gave you that  &#010;hint.&#010;&#010;Op Tue, 09 Dec 2014 16:01:11 +0100 schreef Adrien Ruffié  &#010;&lt;adriennolarsen@hotmail.fr&gt;:&#010;&#010;&gt; Hello all,&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I Have several test packages, for example com.myapp.test1,  &#010;&gt; com.myapp.test2,&#010;&gt; com.myapp.test3&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; How I can exclude by parameter one package ? for example:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; mvn test –DskipTests=com.myapp.test1&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Or&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; mvn test –Dtest.exclude=com.myapp.test2&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I have try both, and no success …&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Thank and best regards.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Adrien Ruffié&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Subject  :-RE: Exclude unit test by parameter
contents:- Thank Robert, &#010;If I understand correctly, I only need to launch with &#010;&#010;mvn test –Dtest=!com.myapp.test1.*&#010;&#010;right ?&#010;&#010;-----Message d'origine-----&#010;De : Robert Scholte [mailto:rfscholte@apache.org] &#010;Envoyé : mardi 9 décembre 2014 19:26&#010;À : Maven Users List&#010;Objet : Re: Exclude unit test by parameter&#010;&#010;Please read&#010;http://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/test-mojo.html#test&#010;&#010;thanks,&#010;Robert&#010;&#010;ps I wonder why you thought the other would work or what/who gave you that hint.&#010;&#010;Op Tue, 09 Dec 2014 16:01:11 +0100 schreef Adrien Ruffié&#010;&lt;adriennolarsen@hotmail.fr&gt;:&#010;&#010;&gt; Hello all,&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I Have several test packages, for example com.myapp.test1, &#010;&gt; com.myapp.test2,&#010;&gt; com.myapp.test3&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; How I can exclude by parameter one package ? for example:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; mvn test –DskipTests=com.myapp.test1&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Or&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; mvn test –Dtest.exclude=com.myapp.test2&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I have try both, and no success …&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Thank and best regards.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Adrien Ruffié&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;
