Name  :- Venkat Ramakrishnan &lt;venkat.archit...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Error while creating hadoop package 2.6.0 with Maven 3.2.3
contents:- Robert,&#010;&#010;Even JDK 7 has those strict checks :-(.&#010;&#010;Thanks,&#010;Venkat.&#010;&#010;&#010;On Fri, Dec 19, 2014 at 2:35 PM, Venkat Ramakrishnan &lt;&#010;venkat.architect@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Thanks Robert.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Yes, you are right, I am using the latest version of JDK. I fixed&#010;&gt; the javadoc, and it seems to be working fine, though I am getting&#010;&gt; exceptions&#010;&gt; in next area! (not Maven).&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; If you think downgrading JDK to the previous version will resolve&#010;&gt; many of my issues, I will go ahead and do it.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; All I want to do is to install Hadoop, and then run Pig for a data&#010;&gt; analysis that I am pursuing.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Thanks,&#010;&gt; Venkat.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Fri, Dec 19, 2014 at 2:22 PM, Robert Scholte &lt;rfscholte@apache.org&gt;&#010;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; So this is not a Maven3 issue, but a JDK8 (kind of) issue. (seems like&#010;&gt;&gt; you upgraded the JDK as well)&#010;&gt;&gt; Oracle introduced with JDK8 a more strict parsing of the javadocs.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Since the javadoc is incorrect, it fails.&#010;&gt;&gt; You have 3 options:&#010;&gt;&gt; - Use JDK7 or less&#010;&gt;&gt; - Fix the javadoc. The problem here is that &lt;String&gt; and &lt;File&gt; are&#010;&gt;&gt; invalid HTML-tags. You should escape it to &amp;lt;String&amp;gt; and &amp;lt;File&amp;gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; - Add -Xdoclint:none or -Xdoclint:syntax (I think), see docs[1]. This way&#010;&gt;&gt; you can suppress these errors.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; The maven-javadoc-plugin still struggles a bit with -Xdoclint[2]. A&#010;&gt;&gt; single -Xdoclint argument works fine, multiple is not yet supported(comma&#010;&gt;&gt; separation handling fails).&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; thanks,&#010;&gt;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; [1] https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/tools/&#010;&gt;&gt; unix/javadoc.html#BEJEFABE&#010;&gt;&gt; [2] https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MJAVADOC-387&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Op Fri, 19 Dec 2014 04:03:00 +0100 schreef Martin Gainty &lt;&#010;&gt;&gt; mgainty@hotmail.com&gt;:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;  take a look at :&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; /**&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;      * Method getExcludePackageNames.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;      *&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;      * @return List&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;      */&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;     public java.util.List&lt;String&gt; getExcludePackageNames()&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; //if i change&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; //@return List to&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; //@return List&lt;String&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; //i get the same error you get&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; please file enhancement request at&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MJAVADOC&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; thanks,&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; M-&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2014 07:50:15 +0530&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Subject: Fwd: Fwd: Error while creating hadoop package 2.6.0 with Maven&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; 3.2.3&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; From: venkat.architect@gmail.com&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; To: users@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Thanks Robert.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; I did a -e and also a -X, -X option shows error messagesthat are&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; specifically related to 'Unknown tag' for String andFile. Looks like&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; something related to 'Mojo' declaration, butnot sure. I am not a full time&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; developer.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Anything related to Maven with PATH variable?&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Logs attached.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Thanks,Venkat.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; On Thu, Dec 18, 2014 at 11:27 PM, Robert Scholte &lt;rfscholte@apache.org&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; wrote:Hi,&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; I guess you should be able to resolve the warnings, but that's a&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; different issue.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; When the build of the Apache Hadoop Maven Plugins 2.6.0 starts, I only&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; see "Downloading...."&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Normally this should be followed by "Downloaded...", which means that&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; the download attempt actually succeeded.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; For some reason something goes wrong here.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; You might want to add -e to get a stacktrace, which could give you an&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; extra hint (or worst case, add -X for debug logging)&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; thanks,&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Op Thu, 18 Dec 2014 18:18:51 +0100 schreef Venkat Ramakrishnan &lt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; venkat.architect@gmail.com&gt;:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Name  :- shailendra singh &lt;shailendra...@outlook.com&gt;
Subject  :-Creating a jar and a war from a war project
contents:- Hi,&#010;&#010;For some reason I am struggling to &#010;create a war and a jar from a maven war project. I want to create these two artifacts from&#010;my maven war project with following requirements -&#010;&#010;Jar&#010; - This should contain all the class files and dependencies of war &#010;project. However dependencies should be copied under lib folder of this &#010;jar and should not be in unpacked form. This part is giving me problem.&#010;&#010;War&#010; - For war I simply want to have static artifacts and nothing which is &#010;present under WEB-INF folder. I am able to achieve this using maven war &#010;plugin.&#010;&#010;Here is the code present under &lt;build&gt; tag of my pom.xml -&#010;&lt;build&gt;&#010;        &lt;plugins&gt;&#010;            &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;                &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-compiler-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;                &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;                    &lt;source&gt;1.8&lt;/source&gt;&#010;                    &lt;target&gt;1.8&lt;/target&gt;&#010;                &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;            &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;            &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;                &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-assembly-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;                &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;                    &lt;descriptors&gt;&#010;                        &lt;descriptor&gt;assembly.xml&lt;/descriptor&gt;&#010;                    &lt;/descriptors&gt;&#010;                    &lt;appendAssemblyId&gt;false&lt;/appendAssemblyId&gt;&#010;                    &lt;archive&gt;&#010;                        &lt;manifest&gt;&#010;                            &lt;addClasspath&gt;true&lt;/addClasspath&gt;&#010;                            &lt;classpathPrefix&gt;lib/&lt;/classpathPrefix&gt;&#010;                        &lt;/manifest&gt;&#010;                    &lt;/archive&gt;&#010;                &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;                &lt;executions&gt;&#010;                    &lt;execution&gt;&#010;                        &lt;id&gt;jar-with-dependencies-in-lib&lt;/id&gt;&#010;                        &lt;phase&gt;package&lt;/phase&gt;&#010;                        &lt;goals&gt;&#010;                            &lt;goal&gt;single&lt;/goal&gt;&#010;                        &lt;/goals&gt;&#010;                    &lt;/execution&gt;&#010;                &lt;/executions&gt;&#010;            &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;            &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;                &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-war-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;                &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;                    &lt;packagingExcludes&gt;WEB-INF/&lt;/packagingExcludes&gt;&#010;                    &lt;failOnMissingWebXml&gt;false&lt;/failOnMissingWebXml&gt;&#010;                &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;            &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&#010;        &lt;/plugins&gt;&#010;    &lt;/build&gt;&#010;&#010;Here is content of assembly.xml file which is located directly under project root directory&#010;- &#010;&#010;&lt;assembly&#010;    xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2"&#010;    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"&#010;    xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2&#010;http://maven.apache.org/xsd/assembly-1.1.2.xsd"&gt;&#010;    &lt;id&gt;jar-with-dependencies-in-lib&lt;/id&gt;&#010;    &lt;formats&gt;&#010;        &lt;format&gt;jar&lt;/format&gt;&#010;    &lt;/formats&gt;&#010;    &lt;includeBaseDirectory&gt;false&lt;/includeBaseDirectory&gt;&#010;    &lt;fileSets&gt;&#010;        &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;            &lt;directory&gt;target/${project.artifactId}-${project.version}/WEB-INF/lib&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;            &lt;includes&gt;&#010;                &lt;include&gt;target/${project.artifactId}-${project.version}/WEB-INF/classes&lt;/include&gt;&#010;              &lt;/includes&gt;&#010;        &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;    &lt;/fileSets&gt;&#010;&lt;/assembly&gt;&#010;&#010;I&#010; feel that I don't need maven-war-plugin at all and both the artifacts &#010;can be created using maven assembly plugin only. However I am unable to &#010;figure out how to achieve this.&#010;&#010;- Shailendra&#010; &#009;&#009; &#009;   &#009;&#009;   &#009;&#009; &#009;   &#009;&#009;  &#010;

               &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;                    &lt;packagingExcludes&gt;WEB-INF/&lt;/packagingExcludes&gt;&#010;                    &lt;failOnMissingWebXml&gt;false&lt;/failOnMissingWebXml&gt;&#010;                &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;            &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&#010;        &lt;/plugins&gt;&#010;    &lt;/build&gt;&#010;&#010;Here is content of assembly.xml file which is located directly under project root directory&#010;- &#010;&#010;&lt;assembly&#010;    xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2"&#010;    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"&#010;    xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2&#010;http://maven.apache.org/xsd/assembly-1.1.2.xsd"&gt;&#010;    &lt;id&gt;jar-with-dependencies-in-lib&lt;/id&gt;&#010;    &lt;formats&gt;&#010;        &lt;format&gt;jar&lt;/format&gt;&#010;    &lt;/formats&gt;&#010;    &lt;includeBaseDirectory&gt;false&lt;/includeBaseDirectory&gt;&#010;    &lt;fileSets&gt;&#010;        &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;            &lt;directory&gt;target/${project.artifactId}-${project.version}/WEB-INF/lib&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;            &lt;includes&gt;&#010;                &lt;include&gt;target/${project.artifactId}-${project.version}/WEB-INF/classes&lt;/include&gt;&#010;              &lt;/includes&gt;&#010;        &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;    &lt;/fileSets&gt;&#010;&lt;/assembly&gt;&#010;&#010;I&#010; Name  :- &quot;Robert Scholte&quot; &lt;rfscho...@apache.org&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Creating a jar and a war from a war project
contents:- Hi,&#010;&#010;have a look at the following parameters of the manve-war plugin:&#010;- archiveClasses[1]&#010;- attachClasses[2]&#010;&#010;I suggest *not* to use the maven-assembly-plugin in this case. It'll make  &#010;things over-complex.&#010;&#010;thanks,&#010;Robert&#010;&#010;[1]  &#010;http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-war-plugin/war-mojo.html#archiveClasses&#010;[2]  &#010;http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-war-plugin/war-mojo.html#attachClasses&#010;&#010;&#010;Op Fri, 19 Dec 2014 08:03:22 +0100 schreef shailendra singh  &#010;&lt;shailendra_01@outlook.com&gt;:&#010;&#010;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; For some reason I am struggling to&#010;&gt; create a war and a jar from a maven war project. I want to create these  &#010;&gt; two artifacts from my maven war project with following requirements -&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Jar&#010;&gt;  - This should contain all the class files and dependencies of war&#010;&gt; project. However dependencies should be copied under lib folder of this&#010;&gt; jar and should not be in unpacked form. This part is giving me problem.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; War&#010;&gt;  - For war I simply want to have static artifacts and nothing which is&#010;&gt; present under WEB-INF folder. I am able to achieve this using maven war&#010;&gt; plugin.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Here is the code present under &lt;build&gt; tag of my pom.xml -&#010;&gt; &lt;build&gt;&#010;&gt;         &lt;plugins&gt;&#010;&gt;             &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-compiler-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt;                     &lt;source&gt;1.8&lt;/source&gt;&#010;&gt;                     &lt;target&gt;1.8&lt;/target&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;&gt;             &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&gt;             &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-assembly-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt;                     &lt;descriptors&gt;&#010;&gt;                         &lt;descriptor&gt;assembly.xml&lt;/descriptor&gt;&#010;&gt;                     &lt;/descriptors&gt;&#010;&gt;                     &lt;appendAssemblyId&gt;false&lt;/appendAssemblyId&gt;&#010;&gt;                     &lt;archive&gt;&#010;&gt;                         &lt;manifest&gt;&#010;&gt;                             &lt;addClasspath&gt;true&lt;/addClasspath&gt;&#010;&gt;                             &lt;classpathPrefix&gt;lib/&lt;/classpathPrefix&gt;&#010;&gt;                         &lt;/manifest&gt;&#010;&gt;                     &lt;/archive&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;executions&gt;&#010;&gt;                     &lt;execution&gt;&#010;&gt;                         &lt;id&gt;jar-with-dependencies-in-lib&lt;/id&gt;&#010;&gt;                         &lt;phase&gt;package&lt;/phase&gt;&#010;&gt;                         &lt;goals&gt;&#010;&gt;                             &lt;goal&gt;single&lt;/goal&gt;&#010;&gt;                         &lt;/goals&gt;&#010;&gt;                     &lt;/execution&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;/executions&gt;&#010;&gt;             &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&gt;             &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-war-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt;                     &lt;packagingExcludes&gt;WEB-INF/&lt;/packagingExcludes&gt;&#010;&gt;                     &lt;failOnMissingWebXml&gt;false&lt;/failOnMissingWebXml&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;&gt;             &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;         &lt;/plugins&gt;&#010;&gt;     &lt;/build&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Here is content of assembly.xml file which is located directly under  &#010;&gt; project root directory -&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &lt;assembly&#010;&gt;     xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2"&#010;&gt;     xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"&#010;&gt;     xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2&#010; &#010;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/xsd/assembly-1.1.2.xsd"&gt;&#010;&gt;     &lt;id&gt;jar-with-dependencies-in-lib&lt;/id&gt;&#010;&gt;     &lt;formats&gt;&#010;&gt;         &lt;format&gt;jar&lt;/format&gt;&#010;&gt;     &lt;/formats&gt;&#010;&gt;     &lt;includeBaseDirectory&gt;false&lt;/includeBaseDirectory&gt;&#010;&gt;     &lt;fileSets&gt;&#010;&gt;         &lt;fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt;             &lt;directory&gt;target/${project.artifactId}-${project.version}/WEB-INF/lib&lt;/directory&gt;&#010;&gt;             &lt;includes&gt;&#010;&gt;                 &lt;include&gt;target/${project.artifactId}-${project.version}/WEB-INF/classes&lt;/include&gt;&#010;&gt;               &lt;/includes&gt;&#010;&gt;         &lt;/fileSet&gt;&#010;&gt;     &lt;/fileSets&gt;&#010;&gt; &lt;/assembly&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I&#010;&gt;  feel that I don't need maven-war-plugin at all and both the artifacts&#010;&gt; can be created using maven assembly plugin only. Name  :- shailendra singh &lt;shailendra...@outlook.com&gt;
Subject  :-RE: Creating a jar and a war from a war project
contents:- Hi,&#010;&#010;Thank you for your response.&#010;&#010;I am already aware about these two parameters. &#010;&#010;I don't thing 'archiveClasses' parameter will be of any help in my case.&#010;&#010;I had tried to use 'attachClasses' initially but I could not figure out how to pull war dependencies&#010;(and that too in a lib folder) in the jar file which will be generated by setting this parameter&#010;to true.&#010;&#010;So I have no solution for my problem yet.&#010;&#010;Thanks&#010;Shailendra&#010;&#010;&gt; To: users@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; Subject: Re: Creating a jar and a war from a war project&#010;&gt; Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2014 09:54:58 +0100&#010;&gt; From: rfscholte@apache.org&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; have a look at the following parameters of the manve-war plugin:&#010;&gt; - archiveClasses[1]&#010;&gt; - attachClasses[2]&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; I suggest *not* to use the maven-assembly-plugin in this case. It'll make  &#010;&gt; things over-complex.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; thanks,&#010;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; [1]  &#010;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-war-plugin/war-mojo.html#archiveClasses&#010;&gt; [2]  &#010;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-war-plugin/war-mojo.html#attachClasses&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Op Fri, 19 Dec 2014 08:03:22 +0100 schreef shailendra singh  &#010;&gt; &lt;shailendra_01@outlook.com&gt;:&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &gt; Hi,&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; For some reason I am struggling to&#010;&gt; &gt; create a war and a jar from a maven war project. I want to create these  &#010;&gt; &gt; two artifacts from my maven war project with following requirements -&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Jar&#010;&gt; &gt;  - This should contain all the class files and dependencies of war&#010;&gt; &gt; project. However dependencies should be copied under lib folder of this&#010;&gt; &gt; jar and should not be in unpacked form. This part is giving me problem.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; War&#010;&gt; &gt;  - For war I simply want to have static artifacts and nothing which is&#010;&gt; &gt; present under WEB-INF folder. I am able to achieve this using maven war&#010;&gt; &gt; plugin.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Here is the code present under &lt;build&gt; tag of my pom.xml -&#010;&gt; &gt; &lt;build&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;         &lt;plugins&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;             &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-compiler-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                     &lt;source&gt;1.8&lt;/source&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                     &lt;target&gt;1.8&lt;/target&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;             &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;             &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-assembly-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                     &lt;descriptors&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                         &lt;descriptor&gt;assembly.xml&lt;/descriptor&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                     &lt;/descriptors&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                     &lt;appendAssemblyId&gt;false&lt;/appendAssemblyId&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                     &lt;archive&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                         &lt;manifest&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                             &lt;addClasspath&gt;true&lt;/addClasspath&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                             &lt;classpathPrefix&gt;lib/&lt;/classpathPrefix&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                         &lt;/manifest&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                     &lt;/archive&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;executions&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                     &lt;execution&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                         &lt;id&gt;jar-with-dependencies-in-lib&lt;/id&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                         &lt;phase&gt;package&lt;/phase&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                         &lt;goals&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                             &lt;goal&gt;single&lt;/goal&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                         &lt;/goals&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                     &lt;/execution&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;/executions&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;             &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;             &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-war-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                     &lt;packagingExcludes&gt;WEB-INF/&lt;/packagingExcludes&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                     &lt;failOnMissingWebXml&gt;false&lt;/failOnMissingWebXml&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;             &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;         &lt;/plugins&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;     &lt;/build&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Here is content of assembly.xml file which is located directly under  &#010;&gt; &gt; project root directory -&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &lt;assembly&#010;&gt; &gt;     xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2"&#010;&gt; &gt;     xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"&#010;&gt; &gt;     xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/assembly/1.1.2&#010; &#010;&gt; &gt; http://maven.apache.org/xsd/assembly-1.1.2.xsd"&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;     &lt;id&gt;jar-with-dependencies-in-lib&lt;/id&gt;&#010;&gt;             &lt;includes&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;                 &lt;include&gt;target/${project.artifactId}-${project.version}/WEB-INF/classes&lt;/include&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;               &lt;/includes&gt;&#010;&gt; Name  :- &quot;Robert Scholte&quot; &lt;rfscho...@apache.org&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Creating a jar and a war from a war project
contents:- Re-reading your request...&#010;&#010;bq. Jar&#010;&#009;- This should contain all the class files and dependencies of war  &#010;project. However dependencies should be copied under lib folder of this  &#010;jar and should not be in unpacked form.&#010;&#010;I hope you are aware that this conflicts with the jar-specs. The classes  &#010;inside the lib/*.jars won't end up on the classpath, which makes this jar  &#010;useless.&#010;I'd strongly advice you not to solve it as you described.&#010;&#010;thanks,&#010;Robert&#010;&#010;Op Fri, 19 Dec 2014 10:33:19 +0100 schreef shailendra singh  &#010;&lt;shailendra_01@outlook.com&gt;:&#010;&#010;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Thank you for your response.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I am already aware about these two parameters.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I don't thing 'archiveClasses' parameter will be of any help in my case.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I had tried to use 'attachClasses' initially but I could not figure out  &#010;&gt; how to pull war dependencies (and that too in a lib folder) in the jar  &#010;&gt; file which will be generated by setting this parameter to true.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; So I have no solution for my problem yet.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Thanks&#010;&gt; Shailendra&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; To: users@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&gt; Subject: Re: Creating a jar and a war from a war project&#010;&gt;&gt; Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2014 09:54:58 +0100&#010;&gt;&gt; From: rfscholte@apache.org&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; have a look at the following parameters of the manve-war plugin:&#010;&gt;&gt; - archiveClasses[1]&#010;&gt;&gt; - attachClasses[2]&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I suggest *not* to use the maven-assembly-plugin in this case. It'll  &#010;&gt;&gt; make&#010;&gt;&gt; things over-complex.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; thanks,&#010;&gt;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; [1]&#010;&gt;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-war-plugin/war-mojo.html#archiveClasses&#010;&gt;&gt; [2]&#010;&gt;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-war-plugin/war-mojo.html#attachClasses&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Op Fri, 19 Dec 2014 08:03:22 +0100 schreef shailendra singh&#010;&gt;&gt; &lt;shailendra_01@outlook.com&gt;:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; Hi,&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; For some reason I am struggling to&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; create a war and a jar from a maven war project. I want to create  &#010;&gt;&gt; these&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; two artifacts from my maven war project with following requirements -&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; Jar&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;  - This should contain all the class files and dependencies of war&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; project. However dependencies should be copied under lib folder of  &#010;&gt;&gt; this&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; jar and should not be in unpacked form. This part is giving me  &#010;&gt;&gt; problem.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; War&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;  - For war I simply want to have static artifacts and nothing which is&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; present under WEB-INF folder. I am able to achieve this using maven  &#010;&gt;&gt; war&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; plugin.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; Here is the code present under &lt;build&gt; tag of my pom.xml -&#010;&gt;&gt; Name  :- Ron Wheeler &lt;rwhee...@artifact-software.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Creating a jar and a war from a war project
contents:- Starting with an explanation of what you are trying to accomplish rather &#010;than with what problem you are experiencing, usually makes the problem &#010;easier to solve and makes the advice you get actually helpful.&#010;&#010;What are you trying to do that makes your requirements so non-standard?&#010;&#010;If you are just trying to separate the war from the code, this is pretty &#010;standard and a good idea.&#010;You make 2 projects, one to make the jar and another to make the war.&#010;Both become trivial examples of maven projects and do not require any &#010;crazy plug-in configurations.&#010;The war has a dependency on the jar.&#010;&#010;If you want to install the jar separately from your war(jar not included &#010;the war), make the jar dependency in your war POM as scope "provided".&#010;Maven will not put any jar contents in the war file and will leave it up &#010;to the Servlet container to find the classes.&#010;The jar is nothing special and all of the components will be where they &#010;are supposed to be and you will have no trouble when you try to run your &#010;app.&#010;&#010;http://blog.artifact-software.com/tech/?tag=maven has some articles that &#010;I wrote on making multi-project application work with Maven with this &#010;sort of separation of libraries from war configuration.&#010;&#010;Ron&#010;&#010;On 19/12/2014 5:18 AM, Robert Scholte wrote:&#010;&gt; Re-reading your request...&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; bq. Jar&#010;&gt;     - This should contain all the class files and dependencies of war &#010;&gt; project. However dependencies should be copied under lib folder of &#010;&gt; this jar and should not be in unpacked form.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I hope you are aware that this conflicts with the jar-specs. The &#010;&gt; classes inside the lib/*.jars won't end up on the classpath, which &#010;&gt; makes this jar useless.&#010;&gt; I'd strongly advice you not to solve it as you described.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; thanks,&#010;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Op Fri, 19 Dec 2014 10:33:19 +0100 schreef shailendra singh &#010;&gt; &lt;shailendra_01@outlook.com&gt;:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Thank you for your response.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I am already aware about these two parameters.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I don't thing 'archiveClasses' parameter will be of any help in my case.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I had tried to use 'attachClasses' initially but I could not figure &#010;&gt;&gt; out how to pull war dependencies (and that too in a lib folder) in &#010;&gt;&gt; the jar file which will be generated by setting this parameter to true.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; So I have no solution for my problem yet.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Thanks&#010;&gt;&gt; Shailendra&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; To: users@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Subject: Re: Creating a jar and a war from a war project&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2014 09:54:58 +0100&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; From: rfscholte@apache.org&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; have a look at the following parameters of the manve-war plugin:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; - archiveClasses[1]&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; - attachClasses[2]&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; I suggest *not* to use the maven-assembly-plugin in this case. It'll &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; make&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; things over-complex.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; thanks,&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; [1]&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-war-plugin/war-mojo.html#archiveClasses&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; [2]&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-war-plugin/war-mojo.html#attachClasses&#010;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Op Fri, 19 Dec 2014 08:03:22 +0100 schreef shailendra singh&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;shailendra_01@outlook.com&gt;:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; Hi,&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; For some reason I am struggling to&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; create a war and a jar from a maven war project. I want to create &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; these&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; two artifacts from my maven war project with following requirements -&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; Jar&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;  - This should contain all the class files and dependencies of war&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; project. &gt;     &lt;/fileSets&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &lt;/assembly&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; I&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;  feel that I don't need maven-war-plugin at all and both the &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; artifacts&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; can be created using maven assembly plugin only. However I am &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; unable to&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; figure out how to achieve this.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; - Shailendra&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Ron Wheeler&#010;President&#010;Artifact Software Inc&#010;email: rwheeler@artifact-software.com&#010;skype: ronaldmwheeler&#010;phone: 866-970-2435, ext 102&#010;&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- shailendra singh &lt;shailendra...@outlook.com&gt;
Subject  :-RE: Creating a jar and a war from a war project
contents:- This page describes my problem -&#010;&#010;https://github.com/koyadume/piston-master/wiki/App&#010;&#010;- Shailendra&#010;&#010;&gt; Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2014 08:09:35 -0500&#010;&gt; From: rwheeler@artifact-software.com&#010;&gt; To: users@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; Subject: Re: Creating a jar and a war from a war project&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Starting with an explanation of what you are trying to accomplish rather &#010;&gt; than with what problem you are experiencing, usually makes the problem &#010;&gt; easier to solve and makes the advice you get actually helpful.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; What are you trying to do that makes your requirements so non-standard?&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; If you are just trying to separate the war from the code, this is pretty &#010;&gt; standard and a good idea.&#010;&gt; You make 2 projects, one to make the jar and another to make the war.&#010;&gt; Both become trivial examples of maven projects and do not require any &#010;&gt; crazy plug-in configurations.&#010;&gt; The war has a dependency on the jar.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; If you want to install the jar separately from your war(jar not included &#010;&gt; the war), make the jar dependency in your war POM as scope "provided".&#010;&gt; Maven will not put any jar contents in the war file and will leave it up &#010;&gt; to the Servlet container to find the classes.&#010;&gt; The jar is nothing special and all of the components will be where they &#010;&gt; are supposed to be and you will have no trouble when you try to run your &#010;&gt; app.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; http://blog.artifact-software.com/tech/?tag=maven has some articles that &#010;&gt; I wrote on making multi-project application work with Maven with this &#010;&gt; sort of separation of libraries from war configuration.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Ron&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; On 19/12/2014 5:18 AM, Robert Scholte wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; Re-reading your request...&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; bq. Jar&#010;&gt; &gt;     - This should contain all the class files and dependencies of war &#010;&gt; &gt; project. However dependencies should be copied under lib folder of &#010;&gt; &gt; this jar and should not be in unpacked form.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; I hope you are aware that this conflicts with the jar-specs. The &#010;&gt; &gt; classes inside the lib/*.jars won't end up on the classpath, which &#010;&gt; &gt; makes this jar useless.&#010;&gt; &gt; I'd strongly advice you not to solve it as you described.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; thanks,&#010;&gt; &gt; Robert&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Op Fri, 19 Dec 2014 10:33:19 +0100 schreef shailendra singh &#010;&gt; &gt; &lt;shailendra_01@outlook.com&gt;:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; Thank you for your response.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; I am already aware about these two parameters.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; I don't thing 'archiveClasses' parameter will be of any help in my case.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; I had tried to use 'attachClasses' initially but I could not figure &#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; out how to pull war dependencies (and that too in a lib folder) in &#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; the jar file which will be generated by setting this parameter to true.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; So I have no solution for my problem yet.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; Thanks&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; Shailendra&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; To: users@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Subject: Re: Creating a jar and a war from a war project&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2014 09:54:58 +0100&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; From: rfscholte@apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Hi,&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; have a look at the following parameters of the manve-war plugin:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; - archiveClasses[1]&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; - attachClasses[2]&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; I suggest *not* to use the maven-assembly-plugin in this case. It'll &#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; make&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; things over-complex.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; thanks,&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; [1]&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-war-plugin/war-mojo.html#archiveClasses&#010;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; [2]&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-war-plugin/war-mojo.html#attachClasses&#010;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Op Fri, 19 Dec 2014 08:03:22 +0100 schreef shailendra singh&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &lt;shailendra_01@outlook.com&gt;:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; Hi,&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; For some reason I am struggling to&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; create a war and a jar from a maven war project. I want to create &#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; these&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; two artifacts from my maven war project with following requirements&#010;-&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; Jar&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;  - This should contain all the class files and dependencies of war&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; project. However dependencies should be copied under lib folder of&#010;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; this&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; jar and should not be in unpacked form. This part is giving me &#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; problem.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; War&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;  - For war I simply want to have static artifacts and nothing &#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; which is&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; present under WEB-INF folder. Subject  :-classifier on test artifact
contents:- Hi all,&#010;Over on Blur we're trying to improve the way we build against the&#010;various hadoop versions.  We currently change the projectVersion to&#010;build the artifact and we'd like to use classifiers to achieve the&#010;same thing (described here[1]).&#010;&#010;By setting a "hadoopClassifier" inside the profile and using that&#010;inside the classifier tag, I can get the desired behavior on the main&#010;artifact (e.g. named blur-core-0.2.4-incubating-SNAPSHOT-hadoop2.jar -&#010;where "hadoop2" is the profile).  The problem is that the test-jar&#010;artifact doesn't include the profile name in it.  I've tried adding&#010;the classifier to the execution element of the test-jar goal as well&#010;with no luck.&#010;&#010;Is there a way to achieve this?  I'll happily accept pointers to a doc&#010;and read myself if you have such a link...&#010;&#010;Thanks,&#010;--tim&#010;&#010;[1] - http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/incubator-blur-dev/201411.mbox/%3CCAG_bHoyAE0EvtjPX8Dim7p5dey6CWNgw0c4OwuJ%2BCWu5Ff1S2A%40mail.gmail.com%3E&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Kristian Rosenvold &lt;krosenv...@apache.org&gt;
Subject  :-[ANN] Apache Maven Assembly Plugin 2.5.3 Released
contents:- The Apache Maven team is pleased to announce the release of the&#010;Apache Maven Assembly Plugin, version 2.5.3.&#010;&#010;The Assembly Plugin for Maven is primarily intended to allow users to aggregate&#010;the project output along with its dependencies, modules, site documentation,&#010;and other files into a single distributable archive.&#010;&#010;This release is a bugfix release.&#010;&#010;http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/&#010;&#010;You should specify the version in your project's plugin configuration:&#010;&#010;&lt;plugin&gt;&#010;  &lt;groupId&gt;org.apache.maven.plugins&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;  &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-assembly-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;  &lt;version&gt;2.5.3&lt;/version&gt;&#010;&lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&#010;&#010;Release Notes - Maven Assembly Plugin - Version 2.5.3&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;** Bug&#010;    * [MASSEMBLY-648] - lineEnding in fileSet corrupts jar files&#010;    * [MASSEMBLY-665] - OS dependent behaviour while packaging&#010;    * [MASSEMBLY-735] - NullPointerException at&#010;org.apache.commons.compress.archivers.zip.FallbackZipEncoding.encode(FallbackZipEncoding.java:80)&#010;    * [MASSEMBLY-739] - directory permissions are not 755 but 000 in zip&#010;    * [MASSEMBLY-741] - wrong paths in file-modes tests&#010;    * [MASSEMBLY-742] - Unclosed ZipFile warnings when ZIP archives are included&#010;    * [MASSEMBLY-743] - &lt;includeBaseDirectory&gt; not correct&#010;&#010;** Improvement&#010;    * [MASSEMBLY-720] - Fixed Checkstyle reported errors / warnings&#010;    * [MASSEMBLY-738] - Upgrade to plexus-archiver from 2.8.4 to&#010;2.9.1 and plexus-io from 2.3.5 to 2.4.1&#010;&#010;&#010;Enjoy,&#010;&#010;-The Apache Maven team&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Stephen Connolly &lt;stephen.alan.conno...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: How to copy unversioned test resources during release:perform?
contents:- Hmmm that is an interesting problem...&#010;&#010;One solution would be to add a goal to&#010;http://maven.apache.org/maven-release/maven-release-plugin/perform-mojo.html#goalsthat&#010;does the copy, for example you could have the default execution of&#010;antrun:run copy the resources if they exist in ../../src/somepath but not&#010;at ./src/somepath and then specify &lt;goals&gt;antrun:run deploy&#010;site-deploy&lt;/goals&gt;&#010;&#010;Note that if you use file based profile activation to skip the tests if the&#010;files are missing, you will need to ensure that the profile is forced&#010;active/inactive as the file based activation will have been triggered&#010;before antrun:run runs... you can force profile activation with&#010;&lt;arguments&gt;-P+someprofile -P-anotherprofile&lt;/arguments&gt; where you want to&#010;ensure that `someprofile` is active and `anotherprofile` is inactive&#010;&#010;OTOH I would like a better solution for this class of problem, but short of&#010;writing a plugin to help (i.e. does the exact thing that the antrun&#010;execution would do, but in a more failsafe kind of way... would still hit&#010;the profile activation issue, but such a plugin could also set some&#010;properties for you depending on whether it has the files or not, so one&#010;could leverage the properties to skip some tests if needed)&#010;&#010;&#010;On 31 December 2013 02:57, Markus Malkusch &lt;markus@malkusch.de&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Hi&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I have test resources which are not in SCM. As testing is part of&#010;&gt; release:perform that fails without those resources. How can I tell Maven to&#010;&gt; copy those unversioned test resources into target/checkout/target/test-classes/.&#010;&gt; I really would prefer not to skip testing. Those test resource won't come&#010;&gt; into the public SCM as they have credentials for a webservice.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Markus&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- Stephen Connolly &lt;stephen.alan.conno...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: New logo?
contents:- two more that I drew over the holidays:&#010;&#010;http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-12.png (in&#010;context:&#010;http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/screenshot-12.png)&#010;&#010;http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-13.png (in&#010;context:&#010;http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/screenshot-13.png)&#010;&#010;I really would like some contributions from the community rather than just&#010;things that I have sketched...&#010;&#010;At present, to my mind, the ones worth consideration are:&#010;&#010;http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-3a.png&#010;http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-5.png&#010;http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-7b.png&#010;http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-9.png (note&#010;would need to check if we can use this one)&#010;http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-12.png&#010;http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-13.png&#010;&#010;In terms of image rights, these are all sketched by me, in some cases I was&#010;using images or photos that I took myself (3a , 5 and 13). In other cases I&#010;traced photos from the web. -9 is the most problematic, both from the point&#010;of an all black silhouette being used as a logo for another company using&#010;the Maven mark (but not in our context... we'd need to ask permission) but&#010;also being a direct trace of an image on the web... if people really like&#010;-9 then we would need to seek permission for that type of image and perhaps&#010;try and commission somebody to draw a similar silhouette rather than my&#010;direct trace. -12 is a composition including a direct trace of the outline&#010;of a photo of the totem carving of the raven, but the inner detail I drew&#010;myself as a study of the original... so slightly more complex origin...&#010;again, if this type of look is popular we can look into getting the&#010;approval to use the image.&#010;&#010;If we can get a few community contributions then I will start a vote&#010;run-off... I don't want to have a run-off with only my contributions as I&#010;just don't think that is the spirit of the community that we are (but hey&#010;if nobody else is willing to try their hand, perhaps we will be reduced to&#010;a run-off of my creations)&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;On 21 December 2013 12:25, Stephen Connolly &lt;stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&#010;&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Having thought about it overnight... if people really want to go with a&#010;&gt; non-stylised raven we can always ask for permission:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-9.png&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; OTOH here is a different stylised version&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-10.png&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Finally, here is a raven totem&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-11.png&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I think this last one could be put in a forest with sky background... just&#010;&gt; haven't had time to do it&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On 20 December 2013 22:26, Stephen Connolly &lt;&#010;&gt; stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I think we can't go with the raven....&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; http://www.prweb.com/releases/2012/3/prweb9334175.htm&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Given that a different non-competing user of the name is using a raven in&#010;&gt;&gt; their logo&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; On Friday, 20 December 2013, Manfred Moser wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; On Dec 20, 2013, at 1:01 PM, Manfred Moser &lt;manfred@simpligility.com&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; I would move the Raven closer to the word Maven but otherwise this&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; looks&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; good imho. Of course I am not sure if everyone would recognize it as&#010;a&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; raven ..&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; That’s my problem….  doesn’t look like a raven to me at all.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; When I first looked at it, I guess the “mouth + tough” part seemed to&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; look&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; more like the Seattle SeaHawks logo stuck on a boot with a weird swirly&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; thing at the ankle.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; In other words, a little to “abstract” for me.   :-)&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Fair enough. I guess living in the pacific northwest I am exposed to&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; these&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; depictions a lot so I can tell. In other cases I&#010;traced photos from the web. -9 is the most problematic, both from the point&#010;of an all black silhouette being used as a logo for another company using&#010;the Maven mark (but not in our context... we'd need to ask permission) but&#010;also being a direct trace of an image on the web... if people really like&#010;-9 then we would need to seek permission for that type of image and perhaps&#010;try and commission somebody to draw a similar silhouette rather than my&#010;direct trace. -12 is a composition including a direct trace of the outline&#010;of a photo of the totem carving of the raven, but the inner detail I drew&#010;myself as a study of the original... so slightly more complex origin...&#010;again, if this type of look is popular we can look into getting the&#010;approval to use the image.&#010;&#010;If we can get a few community contributions then I will start a vote&#010;run-off... In&#010;&gt; other&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; cases I traced photos from the web. -9 is the most problematic, both&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;from&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; the point of an all black silhouette being used as a logo for another&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; company using the Maven mark (but not in our context... we'd need to&#010;&gt; ask&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; permission) but also being a direct trace of an image on the web...&#010;&gt; if&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; people really like -9 then we would need to seek permission for that&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;type&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; of image and perhaps try and commission somebody to draw a similar&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; silhouette rather than my direct trace. -12 is a composition&#010;&gt; including a&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; direct trace of the outline of a photo of the totem carving of the&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;raven,&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; but the inner detail I drew myself as a study of the original... so&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; slightly more complex origin... again, if this type of look is&#010;&gt; popular&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;we&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; can look into getting the approval to use the image.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; If we can get a few community contributions then I will start a vote&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; run-off... I don't want to have a run-off with only my contributions&#010;&gt; as&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;I&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; just don't think that is the spirit of the community that we are (but&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;hey&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; if nobody else is willing to try their hand, perhaps we will be&#010;&gt; reduced&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;to&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; a run-off of my creations)&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; On 21 December 2013 12:25, Stephen Connolly &lt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; http://people.apache.org/~stephenc/maven-logo-contest/maven-13.png&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; In terms of image rights, these are all sketched by me, in some&#010;&gt;&gt; cases I&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; was using images or photos that I took myself (3a , 5 and 13).&#010;In&#010;&gt;&gt; other&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; cases I traced photos from the web. -9 is the most problematic,&#010;both&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;from&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; the point of an all black silhouette being used as a logo for another&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; company using the Maven mark (but not in our context... we'd need&#010;to&#010;&gt;&gt; ask&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; permission) but also being a direct trace of an image on the web...&#010;&gt;&gt; if&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; people really like -9 then we would need to seek permission for&#010;that&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;type&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; of image and perhaps try and commission somebody to draw a similar&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; silhouette rather than my direct trace. -12 is a composition&#010;&gt;&gt; including a&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; direct trace of the outline of a photo of the totem carving of&#010;the&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;raven,&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; but the inner detail I drew myself as a study of the original...&#010;so&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; slightly more complex origin... again, if this type of look is&#010;&gt;&gt; popular&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;we&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; can look into getting the approval to use the image.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; I think this last one could be put in a forest with sky&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; background...&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; just haven't had time to do it&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; On 20 December 2013 22:26, Stephen Connolly &lt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Given that a different non-competing user of the name&#010;is using a&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; raven&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; in their logo&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On Friday, 20 December 2013, Manfred Moser wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; I would move the Raven closer to the&#010;word Maven but&#010;&gt; otherwise&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; this&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; looks&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; good imho. Of course I am not sure if&#010;everyone would&#010;&gt; recognize&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; it&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;as&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; a&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; raven ..&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; That¹s my problemŠ.  doesn¹t look like&#010;a raven to me at all.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; When I first looked at it, I guess the ³mouth&#010;+ tough² part&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; seemed&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;to&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; look&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; more like the Seattle SeaHawks logo stuck&#010;on a boot with a&#010;&gt; weird&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; swirly&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; thing at the ankle.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; In other words, a little to ³abstract²&#010;for me.   :-)&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Fair enough. I guess living in the pacific northwest&#010;I am&#010;&gt; exposed&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; to&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; these&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; depictions a lot so I can tell. But globally we&#010;might have to&#010;&gt; make&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;it a&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; bit clearer. I guess living in the pacific&#010;northwest I am&#010;&gt;&gt; exposed&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; to&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; these&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; depictions a lot so I can tell. But globally&#010;we might have to&#010;&gt;&gt; make&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;it a&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; bit clearer. Of course I am not sure if everyone&#010;would recognize&#010;&gt; &gt; it&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;as&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; a&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&gt; raven ..&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; That¹s my problemŠ.  doesn¹t look like a raven&#010;to me at all.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; When I first looked at it, I guess the ³mouth +&#010;tough² part&#010;&gt; &gt; seemed&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;to&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; look&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; more like the Seattle SeaHawks logo stuck on a boot&#010;with a&#010;&gt; weird&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; swirly&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; thing at the ankle.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; In other words, a little to ³abstract² for me.&#010;  :-)&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Fair enough. I guess living in the pacific northwest I&#010;am exposed&#010;&gt; &gt; to&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; these&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; depictions a lot so I can tell. But globally we might&#010;have to&#010;&gt; make&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;it a&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; bit clearer. Name  :- Curtis Rueden &lt;ctrue...@wisc.edu&gt;
Subject  :-Re: New logo?
contents:- Hi all,&#010;&#010;All of the logos are OK, but none of them really symbolize anything in&#010;particular about Maven. IMO the best logos encapsulate the purpose of the&#010;project somehow, either overtly, covertly or both.&#010;&#010;Here is a related article that discusses some of that:&#010;http://www.webdesignerdepot.com/2012/10/the-hidden-meaning-behind-really-good-logos/&#010;&#010;Paul Benedict's idea of letting professionals try their hand at it may be&#010;more worthwhile in the long term. Otherwise we might just end up with yet&#010;another software project with a cute animal that has little if anything to&#010;do with the project itself.&#010;&#010;Regards,&#010;Curtis&#010;&#010;&#010;On Thu, Jan 9, 2014 at 9:12 AM, Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; All rather nicely done. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt; Machines should not be friendly.  Machines should be obedient.&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- &quot;Mark H. Wood&quot; &lt;mw...@IUPUI.Edu&gt;
Subject  :-Re: New logo?
contents:- On Thu, Jan 09, 2014 at 09:32:54AM -0600, Curtis Rueden wrote:&#010;&gt; All of the logos are OK, but none of them really symbolize anything in&#010;&gt; particular about Maven. IMO the best logos encapsulate the purpose of the&#010;&gt; project somehow, either overtly, covertly or both.&#010;&#010;Good point.  I was associating with the name "Maven", looking for a&#010;symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized field.&#010;&#010;http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&#010;So, what does Maven do?  It passes unique source and object code&#010;inputs through a standardized process, guided by an expression of the&#010;relationships among those inputs, to assemble a well-specified&#010;configuration of runnable code.  What does that look like?&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;Machines should not be friendly.  Machines should be obedient.&#010;&#010;

I was associating with the name "Maven", looking for a&#010;&gt; symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized field.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; So, what does Maven do?  It passes unique source and object code&#010;&gt; inputs through a standardized process, guided by an expression of the&#010;&gt; relationships among those inputs, to assemble a well-specified&#010;&gt; configuration of runnable code. Name  :- Tamás Cservenák &lt;ta...@cservenak.net&gt;
Subject  :-Re: New logo?
contents:- About raven, is already "taken":&#010;http://www.maven.co/&#010;&#010;Some "sneaky peaks" for same named (but non related sites) -- just to see&#010;what others came up with:&#010;http://www.maven-sf.com/&#010;http://lasp.colorado.edu/home/maven/&#010;http://www.php-maven.org/&#010;&#010;And my personal fav:&#010;http://mavenberlin.com/en&#010;&#010;Their stylised "M" made out of two triangles is just great.&#010;&#010;&#010;And then, as I also like abstract things a bit more than explicit drawings&#010;representing explicit stuff/beings,&#010;I figured what might represent visually Maven&#010;(I admit, was inspired with MavenBerlin intersecting triangles, as there,&#010;it reflects the intersection of multidisciplinary creativity):&#010;a mountain(s), a twin peak ("M"), you have to climb..... (and everyone&#010;finish their story, mountain might be "effort", "knowledge", "sweat" or&#010;whatever :D )&#010;&#010;Something like these&#010;http://www.leelau.net/2005/clemenceau/Miscellanous/traverseduplicatemountainnwview04.jpg&#010;http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-JFyYp4QeFvU/Td_kvtpZNBI/AAAAAAAAAFk/_axAJllIgF8/s1600/snowcap2.png&#010;&#010;And finally, just a quick quick silly draft of logos, two versions.&#010;&#010;First, is obviously what maven is &lt;today/&gt; :D&#010;&#010;Second is the one with stylized peaks, variations on "M as mountain" idea:D&#010;&#010;http://screencast.com/t/JSpjKNrhBJLJ&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;On Thu, Jan 9, 2014 at 4:51 PM, Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; On Thu, Jan 09, 2014 at 09:32:54AM -0600, Curtis Rueden wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; All of the logos are OK, but none of them really symbolize anything in&#010;&gt; &gt; particular about Maven. IMO the best logos encapsulate the purpose of the&#010;&gt; &gt; project somehow, either overtly, covertly or both.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Good point.  I was associating with the name "Maven", looking for a&#010;&gt; symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized field.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; So, what does Maven do?  It passes unique source and object code&#010;&gt; inputs through a standardized process, guided by an expression of the&#010;&gt; relationships among those inputs, to assemble a well-specified&#010;&gt; configuration of runnable code.  What does that look like?&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; --&#010;&gt; Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt; Machines should not be friendly. Subject  :-Re: New logo?
contents:- Hi Tamás,&#010;&#010;&gt; a mountain(s), a twin peak ("M"), you have to climb..... (and everyone&#010;&gt; finish their story, mountain might be "effort", "knowledge", "sweat"&#010;&gt; or whatever :D )&#010;&#010;That is excellent! And gurus (a.k.a. mavens) also like to live on top of&#010;mountains. ;-)&#010;&#010;Regards,&#010;Curtis&#010;&#010;&#010;On Thu, Jan 9, 2014 at 10:32 AM, Tamás Cservenák &lt;tamas@cservenak.net&gt;wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; About raven, is already "taken":&#010;&gt; http://www.maven.co/&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Some "sneaky peaks" for same named (but non related sites) -- just to see&#010;&gt; what others came up with:&#010;&gt; http://www.maven-sf.com/&#010;&gt; http://lasp.colorado.edu/home/maven/&#010;&gt; http://www.php-maven.org/&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; And my personal fav:&#010;&gt; http://mavenberlin.com/en&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Their stylised "M" made out of two triangles is just great.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; And then, as I also like abstract things a bit more than explicit drawings&#010;&gt; representing explicit stuff/beings,&#010;&gt; I figured what might represent visually Maven&#010;&gt; (I admit, was inspired with MavenBerlin intersecting triangles, as there,&#010;&gt; it reflects the intersection of multidisciplinary creativity):&#010;&gt; a mountain(s), a twin peak ("M"), you have to climb..... (and everyone&#010;&gt; finish their story, mountain might be "effort", "knowledge", "sweat" or&#010;&gt; whatever :D )&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Something like these&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://www.leelau.net/2005/clemenceau/Miscellanous/traverseduplicatemountainnwview04.jpg&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-JFyYp4QeFvU/Td_kvtpZNBI/AAAAAAAAAFk/_axAJllIgF8/s1600/snowcap2.png&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; And finally, just a quick quick silly draft of logos, two versions.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; First, is obviously what maven is &lt;today/&gt; :D&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Second is the one with stylized peaks, variations on "M as mountain" idea:D&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://screencast.com/t/JSpjKNrhBJLJ&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Thu, Jan 9, 2014 at 4:51 PM, Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; On Thu, Jan 09, 2014 at 09:32:54AM -0600, Curtis Rueden wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; All of the logos are OK, but none of them really symbolize anything in&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; particular about Maven. IMO the best logos encapsulate the purpose of&#010;&gt; the&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; project somehow, either overtly, covertly or both.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Good point.  I was associating with the name "Maven", looking for a&#010;&gt; &gt; symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized field.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; So, what does Maven do?  It passes unique source and object code&#010;&gt; &gt; inputs through a standardized process, guided by an expression of the&#010;&gt; &gt; relationships among those inputs, to assemble a well-specified&#010;&gt; &gt; configuration of runnable code.  What does that look like?&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; --&#010;&gt; &gt; Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt; &gt; Machines should not be friendly.  Machines should be obedient.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Subject  :-RE: New logo?
contents:- Here's a VERY rough draft of a possible logo (I'm sure someone else can make it look more sleek):&#010;&#010;http://s21.postimg.org/41q3n4mk7/maven.png&#010;&#010;-----Original Message-----&#010;From: t.cservenak@gmail.com [mailto:t.cservenak@gmail.com] On Behalf Of Tamás Cservenák&#010;Sent: Thursday, January 09, 2014 11:33 AM&#010;To: Maven Users List&#010;Subject: Re: New logo?&#010;&#010;About raven, is already "taken":&#010;http://www.maven.co/&#010;&#010;Some "sneaky peaks" for same named (but non related sites) -- just to see what others came&#010;up with:&#010;http://www.maven-sf.com/&#010;http://lasp.colorado.edu/home/maven/&#010;http://www.php-maven.org/&#010;&#010;And my personal fav:&#010;http://mavenberlin.com/en&#010;&#010;Their stylised "M" made out of two triangles is just great.&#010;&#010;&#010;And then, as I also like abstract things a bit more than explicit drawings representing explicit&#010;stuff/beings, I figured what might represent visually Maven (I admit, was inspired with MavenBerlin&#010;intersecting triangles, as there, it reflects the intersection of multidisciplinary creativity):&#010;a mountain(s), a twin peak ("M"), you have to climb..... IMO the best logos encapsulate the &#010;&gt; &gt; purpose of the project somehow, either overtly, covertly or both.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Good point.  I was associating with the name "Maven", looking for a &#010;&gt; symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized field.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; So, what does Maven do?  It passes unique source and object code &#010;&gt; inputs through a standardized process, guided by an expression of the &#010;&gt; relationships among those inputs, to assemble a well-specified &#010;&gt; configuration of runnable code.  What does that look like?&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; --&#010;&gt; Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt; Machines should not be friendly. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&lt;javascript:;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; On Thu, Jan 09, 2014 at 09:32:54AM -0600, Curtis Rueden wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; All of the logos are OK, but none of them really symbolize&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; anything in particular about Maven. IMO the best logos encapsulate&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; the purpose of the project somehow, either overtly, covertly or both.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Good point.  I was associating with the name "Maven", looking for a&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized field.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; So, what does Maven do?  It passes unique source and object code&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; inputs through a standardized process, guided by an expression of&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; the relationships among those inputs, to assemble a well-specified&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; configuration of runnable code.  What does that look like?&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; --&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Machines should not be friendly. Name  :- Kristian Rosenvold &lt;kristian.rosenv...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: New logo?
contents:- I think the association-work around what maven /is/ is a great way to&#010;approach a logo contest elsewhere. I have worked with some great graphic&#010;designers in my time, and the kind input the good ones want are typically&#010;related around your thoughts/feelings around the product rather than which&#010;particular animal you prefer, which is a bit of a secondary kind of input&#010;along with all different kinds of other constraints/ideas (the boss prefers&#010;blue).&#010;&#010;When I first encountered maven I had come to the realization that all my&#010;ant projects were basically the same, and that there was no reason for&#010;customizing&#010;what was basically a standard process. So maven gives me associations to a&#010;mass-production line at a factory, rather than a tailor making individual&#010;processes. Furthermore, the lifecycle amplifies the idea of a conveyor-belt&#010;mass-production line; all parts move through the same conveyor belt&#010;process, stopping at&#010;individual stages to get work done. I would almost be willing to think of a&#010;waterfall (Uh-oh...)&#010;&#010;So it would appear to me that I'm not thinking of an animal at all !&#010;&#010;Kristian&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;2014/1/9 Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt;&#010;&#010;&gt; On Thu, Jan 09, 2014 at 09:32:54AM -0600, Curtis Rueden wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt; All of the logos are OK, but none of them really symbolize anything in&#010;&gt; &gt; particular about Maven. IMO the best logos encapsulate the purpose of the&#010;&gt; &gt; project somehow, either overtly, covertly or both.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Good point.  I was associating with the name "Maven", looking for a&#010;&gt; symbol of in-depth understanding of a specialized field.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/maven&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; So, what does Maven do?  It passes unique source and object code&#010;&gt; inputs through a standardized process, guided by an expression of the&#010;&gt; relationships among those inputs, to assemble a well-specified&#010;&gt; configuration of runnable code.  What does that look like?&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; --&#010;&gt; Mark H. Wood, Lead System Programmer   mwood@IUPUI.Edu&#010;&gt; Machines should not be friendly.  Machines should be obedient.&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- &quot;Lyons, Roy&quot; &lt;Roy.Ly...@cmegroup.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: New logo?
contents:- HAH.  I like that.  It makes me think of the kids toy where you put shapes&#010;into holes.&#010;&#010;http://www.toysrus.com/graphics/media/trus/Aplusplus/2012/2501235/MATTEL-25&#010;01235-01.jpg&#010;&#010;Each block shape represents a type of output (.war, .jar, .ear, .so, .dll,&#010;.zip, .someotherextensionthatyoudreamup)&#010;&#010;Each hole represents a workflow to make that happen.  Ok its a little bit&#010;reverse order, and more like http://static.ddmcdn.com/gif/play-doh-12.jpg&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;Anyhow, I like the "cookie cutter" approach to a logo because it goes with&#010;Kristian's sentiment (which I happen to agree with once I read it).&#010;&#010;Perhaps even an actual logo as a set of cookie cutters (kind of like&#010;http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41BUOIKf4zL.jpg which is funny&#010;because it has all kinds of animals in it too )&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;On 1/10/14 1:20 AM, "Kristian Rosenvold" &lt;kristian.rosenvold@gmail.com&gt;&#010;wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt;I think the association-work around what maven /is/ is a great way to&#010;&gt;approach a logo contest elsewhere. I have worked with some great graphic&#010;&gt;designers in my time, and the kind input the good ones want are typically&#010;&gt;related around your thoughts/feelings around the product rather than which&#010;&gt;particular animal you prefer, which is a bit of a secondary kind of input&#010;&gt;along with all different kinds of other constraints/ideas (the boss&#010;&gt;prefers&#010;&gt;blue).&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;When I first encountered maven I had come to the realization that all my&#010;&gt;ant projects were basically the same, and that there was no reason for&#010;&gt;customizing&#010;&gt;what was basically a standard process. So maven gives me associations to a&#010;&gt;mass-production line at a factory, rather than a tailor making individual&#010;&gt;processes. Furthermore, the lifecycle amplifies the idea of a&#010;&gt;conveyor-belt&#010;&gt;mass-production line; all parts move through the same conveyor belt&#010;&gt;process, stopping at&#010;&gt;individual stages to get work done. I would almost be willing to think of&#010;&gt;a&#010;&gt;waterfall (Uh-oh...)&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;So it would appear to me that I'm not thinking of an animal at all !&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;Kristian&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;2014/1/9 Mark H. Wood &lt;mwood@iupui.edu&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; On Thu, Jan 09, 2014 at 09:32:54AM -0600, Curtis Rueden wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; All of the logos are OK, but none of them really symbolize anything in&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; particular about Maven. IMO the best logos encapsulate the purpose of&#010;&gt;&gt;the&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; project somehow, either overtly, covertly or both.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Good point. Subject  :-Re: New logo?
contents:- On 10 January 2014 17:19, Arnaud Héritier &lt;aheritier@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; it could be seen also as a coffee machine taking beans in entry to produce&#010;&gt; a cup of java&#010;&gt; The - is that it is fully java minded while Maven tried to conquer (with&#010;&gt; few success) others platforms (C++ ...)&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;One thing that I want to see for Maven 4.0 / model Version 5.0.0 is better&#010;support for arch specific artifacts... which IIRC was one of the main&#010;issues with Maven and other platforms... (besides the "why should I install&#010;this slow JVM on my machine" complaint)&#010;&#010;&#010;&gt; Note : Also the coffee machine can replace some others activities while&#010;&gt; maven is building :-)&#010;&gt; http://blog.octo.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/maven-building.png&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Fri, Jan 10, 2014 at 6:00 PM, Stephen Connolly &lt;&#010;&gt; stephen.alan.connolly@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Do you mean something like maven-16 that I just uploaded to the contest&#010;&gt; &gt; wiki page?&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/download/attachments/38569278/maven-16.png?version=1&amp;modificationDate=1389373170779&amp;api=v2&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; On 10 January 2014 16:40, Kristian Rosenvold&#010;&gt; &gt; &lt;kristian.rosenvold@gmail.com&gt;wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Way cool; this toy is a nordic classic (in wood).
