Name  :- Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;skrive...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Fwd: Maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 - deploy-file goal - unable to avoid attachedArtifacts from being deployed in execute
contents:- Hi&#010;&#010;I have a question about the expected behaviour of the deploy:deploy-file&#010;goal in the maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 which I am currently using to deploy&#010;one file.&#010;&#010;It surprised me that no matter what I did I kept getting more artifacts&#010;deployed that I asked for and the reason is in the&#010;org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo.execute line 376 where the&#010;attached artifacts are also deployed.&#010;&#010;Is this intended behaviour and if so how can I avoid this from happening?&#010;&#010;The goal name deploy-file indicates that one artifact (possible incl.&#010;pom/metadata) is to be deployed and not also a throng of other artifacts.&#010;&#010;I will be happy to provide a patch where this is aspect is removed.&#010;&#010;Thank you in advance&#010;&#010;regards&#010;Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;skrive...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Fwd: Maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 - deploy-file goal - unable to avoid attachedArtifacts from being deployed in execute
contents:- Hi&#010;&#010;I have a question about the expected behaviour of the deploy:deploy-file&#010;goal in the maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 which I am currently using to deploy&#010;one file.&#010;&#010;It surprised me that no matter what I did I kept getting more artifacts&#010;deployed that I asked for and the reason is in the&#010;org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo.execute line 376 where the&#010;attached artifacts are also deployed.&#010;&#010;Is this intended behaviour and if so how can I avoid this from happening?&#010;&#010;The goal name deploy-file indicates that one artifact (possible incl.&#010;pom/metadata) is to be deployed and not also a throng of other artifacts.&#010;&#010;I will be happy to provide a patch where this is aspect is removed.&#010;&#010;Thank you in advance&#010;&#010;regards&#010;Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Anders Hammar &lt;and...@hammar.net&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 - deploy-file goal - unable to avoid attachedArtifacts from being deployed in execute
contents:- You need to provide more info on what you're doing! Is the&#010;deploy:deploy-file bound to the build lifecycle of a project? How?&#010;&#010;/Anders&#010;&#010;&#010;On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 11:06 AM, Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;&#010;skriver79@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Hi&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I have a question about the expected behaviour of the deploy:deploy-file&#010;&gt; goal in the maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 which I am currently using to deploy&#010;&gt; one file.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; It surprised me that no matter what I did I kept getting more artifacts&#010;&gt; deployed that I asked for and the reason is in the&#010;&gt; org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo.execute line 376 where the&#010;&gt; attached artifacts are also deployed.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Is this intended behaviour and if so how can I avoid this from happening?&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; The goal name deploy-file indicates that one artifact (possible incl.&#010;&gt; pom/metadata) is to be deployed and not also a throng of other artifacts.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I will be happy to provide a patch where this is aspect is removed.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Thank you in advance&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; regards&#010;&gt; Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Anders Hammar &lt;and...@hammar.net&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 - deploy-file goal - unable to avoid attachedArtifacts from being deployed in execute
contents:- You should really restart with the module 2 pom.&#010;&#010;Your multi-module structure is good. You have a separate projekt/module&#010;which creates your distro. What you should do is to create the "distro"&#010;(zip or whatever) to be created as part of the normal build and then&#010;deployed as the project's artifact it is.&#010;This is done in many projects and you could for example have a look at the&#010;Maven core project where we create a zip and a tar file.&#010;https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=maven.git;a=tree;f=apache-maven;hb=HEAD&#010;&#010;So in the end, you will not use deploy:deploy-file. Also, your pom will be&#010;very small with pretty much only the m-assembly-p being bound to the build&#010;lifecycle.&#010;&#010;/Anders&#010;&#010;&#010;On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 11:36 AM, Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;&#010;skriver79@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Hi Anders&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I have a multi-module project with this structure:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;  A (root and parent pom project)&#010;&gt;  - module 1 - builds a jar as artifact&#010;&gt;  - module 2  - uses module 1 jar artifact in assembly tries to deploy the&#010;&gt; assembled zip file to artifactory.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; This is the module 2 pom file with YYYY inserted to replace project&#010;&gt; How?&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; /Anders&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 11:06 AM, Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;&#010;&gt; &gt; skriver79@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Hi&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; I have a question about the expected behaviour of the&#010;&gt; deploy:deploy-file&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; goal in the maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 which I am currently using to&#010;&gt; &gt; deploy&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; one file.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; It surprised me that no matter what I did I kept getting more artifacts&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; deployed that I asked for and the reason is in the&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo.execute line 376 where&#010;&gt; the&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; attached artifacts are also deployed.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Is this intended behaviour and if so how can I avoid this from&#010;&gt; happening?&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; The goal name deploy-file indicates that one artifact (possible incl.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; pom/metadata) is to be deployed and not also a throng of other&#010;&gt; artifacts.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; I will be happy to provide a patch where this is aspect is removed.&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Thank you in advance&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; regards&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt; Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;skrive...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 - deploy-file goal - unable to avoid attachedArtifacts from being deployed in execute
contents:- Thanks for the advice on how to restructure.&#010;Could you have a look at the deploy-plugin project and the file&#010;org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo execute method line 376 in&#010;version 2.8.1 ? I would really like to understand the following:&#010;1) What controls which artifacts are attached the model for the given&#010;project?&#010;2) Is it possible to state that no artifacts except explicitly stated&#010;should be created/attached?&#010;3) Is it really the intended behaviour of the deploy:file goal to also&#010;deploy the attached artifacts? To me that is a very non-intuitive&#010;behaviour.&#010;&#010;I Basically have a working setup which deploys the zip file I generate to&#010;repo with the name I have specified. But the only thing that bothers me is&#010;that for some unclear reason the same zip is deployed again with the name&#010;of the project in the same deploy:file goal. To me - that is a bug.&#010;Should I open an issue instead somewhere and provide the patch which fixes&#010;this??&#010;I already mailed the email listed in the top of the java file in question&#010;but he does not reply.&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;Med venlig hilsen&#010;Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&#010;&#010;On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 2:54 PM, Anders Hammar &lt;anders@hammar.net&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; You should really restart with the module 2 pom.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Your multi-module structure is good. You have a separate projekt/module&#010;&gt; which creates your distro. What you should do is to create the "distro"&#010;&gt; (zip or whatever) to be created as part of the normal build and then&#010;&gt; deployed as the project's artifact it is.&#010;&gt; This is done in many projects and you could for example have a look at the&#010;&gt; Maven core project where we create a zip and a tar file.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=maven.git;a=tree;f=apache-maven;hb=HEAD&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; So in the end, you will not use deploy:deploy-file. Also, your pom will be&#010;&gt; very small with pretty much only the m-assembly-p being bound to the build&#010;&gt; lifecycle.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; /Anders&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 11:36 AM, Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;&#010;&gt; ================

Name  :- &quot;Robert Scholte&quot; &lt;rfscho...@apache.org&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 - deploy-file goal - unable to avoid attachedArtifacts from being deployed in execute
contents:- Op Sun, 16 Feb 2014 08:15:25 +0100 schreef Henrik Skriver Rasmussen  &#010;&lt;skriver79@gmail.com&gt;:&#010;&#010;&gt; Thanks for the advice on how to restructure.&#010;&gt; Could you have a look at the deploy-plugin project and the file&#010;&gt; org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo execute method line 376 in&#010;&gt; version 2.8.1 ? I would really like to understand the following:&#010;&gt; 1) What controls which artifacts are attached the model for the given&#010;&gt; project?&#010;&#010;The plugin creating that artifact controls the attaching. For example:&#010;http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-source-plugin/xref/org/apache/maven/plugin/source/AbstractSourceJarMojo.html#307&#010;Here the -sources.jar is attached to the project.&#010;&#010;&gt; 2) Is it possible to state that no artifacts except explicitly stated&#010;&gt; should be created/attached?&#010;&#010;The plugin creating that artifact&#010;&#010;&gt; 3) Is it really the intended behaviour of the deploy:file goal to also&#010;&gt; deploy the attached artifacts? To me that is a very non-intuitive&#010;&gt; behaviour.&#010;&#010;Yes. If there are attachments created and these are attached, they are  &#010;uploaded as well. So if you don't want this, solve it at the source, i.e  &#010;the plugin creating the artifact. (for the maven-source-plugin: skip it  &#010;(best option) or just don't attach (acceptable option) )&#010;For the same reason you won't find "delete" options in any of the plugins.  &#010;It is a matter of excluding the correct files.&#010;&#010;Robert&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I Basically have a working setup which deploys the zip file I generate to&#010;&gt; repo with the name I have specified. But the only thing that bothers me  &#010;&gt; is&#010;&gt; that for some unclear reason the same zip is deployed again with the name&#010;&gt; of the project in the same deploy:file goal. To me - that is a bug.&#010;&gt; Should I open an issue instead somewhere and provide the patch which  &#010;&gt; fixes&#010;&gt; this??&#010;&gt; I already mailed the email listed in the top of the java file in question&#010;&gt; but he does not reply.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Med venlig hilsen&#010;&gt; Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 2:54 PM, Anders Hammar &lt;anders@hammar.net&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; You should really restart with the module 2 pom.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Your multi-module structure is good. You have a separate projekt/module&#010;&gt;&gt; which creates your distro. What you should do is to create the "distro"&#010;&gt;&gt; (zip or whatever) to be created as part of the normal build and then&#010;&gt;&gt; deployed as the project's artifact it is.&#010;&gt;&gt; This is done in many projects and you could for example have a look at  &#010;&gt;&gt; the&#010;&gt;&gt; Maven core project where we create a zip and a tar file.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=maven.git;a=tree;f=apache-maven;hb=HEAD&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; So in the end, you will not use deploy:deploy-file. Also, your pom will  &#010;&gt;&gt; be&#010;&gt;&gt; very small with pretty much only the m-assembly-p being bound to the  &#010;&gt;&gt; build&#010;&gt;&gt; lifecycle.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; /Anders&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 11:36 AM, Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;&#010;&gt;&gt; skriver79@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; Hi Anders&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; I have a multi-module project with this structure:&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;  A (root and parent pom project)&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;  - module 1 - builds a jar as artifact&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;  - module 2  - uses module 1 jar artifact in assembly tries to deploy  &#010;&gt;&gt; the&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; assembled zip file to artifactory.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; This is the module 2 pom file with YYYY inserted to replace project&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; specific names.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &lt;project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &lt;parent&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;  &lt;groupId&gt;YYYY&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt;  &lt;artifactId&gt;YYYY&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; deploy:deploy-file&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; goal in the maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 which I am currently using &#010;&#010;&gt;&gt; to&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; deploy&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; one file.&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; It surprised me that no matter what I did I kept getting more&#010;&gt;&gt; artifacts&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; deployed that I asked for and the reason is in the&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo.execute line 376  &#010;&gt;&gt; where&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; the&#010;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; attached artifacts are also deployed.&#010;&gt;&gt; Name  :- Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;skrive...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 - deploy-file goal - unable to avoid attachedArtifacts from being deployed in execute
contents:- Hi Robert&#010;Thank you for your answer.&#010;&#010;I would like to figure out how to simple skip the generation of the given&#010;extra zip file because I do not know how now.&#010;Any way to see during debug which goal will result in which artifact? Any&#010;help on finding out when running my build will be appreciated.&#010;I can not omit what I do not know to control nor can I not attach it when I&#010;do no what generates it.&#010;&#010;Not creating or attaching the artifact solves the problem - but still, as&#010;user of maven I still say that it is counter intuitive to have the&#010;deploy-file goal not only deploy the specified file.&#010;The deploy goal should deploy all - but not the deploy-file goal. :)&#010;I know that is a different discussion about meaningful naming of APIs and&#010;frankly I don't care now that I know.&#010;But maven developers should care about simplifying and make maven APIs&#010;intuitive since maven is not exactly gaining ground due to it's simplicity&#010;and transparency. ;)&#010;&#010;That being said, I have been using maven for a looong time and enjoy it&#010;most of the time - so keep up the good work!&#010;&#010;regards&#010;Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&#010;&#010;On Sun, Feb 16, 2014 at 2:03 PM, Robert Scholte &lt;rfscholte@apache.org&gt;wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Op Sun, 16 Feb 2014 08:15:25 +0100 schreef Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;&#010;&gt; skriver79@gmail.com&gt;:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;  Thanks for the advice on how to restructure.&#010;&gt;&gt; Could you have a look at the deploy-plugin project and the file&#010;&gt;&gt; org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo execute method line 376 in&#010;&gt;&gt; version 2.8.1 ? I would really like to understand the following:&#010;&gt;&gt; 1) What controls which artifacts are attached the model for the given&#010;&gt;&gt; project?&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; The plugin creating that artifact controls the attaching. For example:&#010;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-source-plugin/&#010;&gt; xref/org/apache/maven/plugin/source/AbstractSourceJarMojo.html#307&#010;&gt; Here the -sources.jar is attached to the project.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;  2) Is it possible to state that no artifacts except explicitly stated&#010;&gt;&gt; should be created/attached?&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; The plugin creating that artifact&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;  3) Is it really the intended behaviour of the deploy:file goal to also&#010;&gt;&gt; deploy the attached artifacts? To me that is a very non-intuitive&#010;&gt;&gt; behaviour.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Yes. If there are attachments created and these are attached, they are&#010;&gt; uploaded as well. So if you don't want this, solve it at the source, i.e&#010;&gt; the plugin creating the artifact. (for the maven-source-plugin: skip it&#010;&gt; (best option) or just don't attach (acceptable option) )&#010;&gt; For the same reason you won't find "delete" options in any of the plugins.&#010;&gt; It is a matter of excluding the correct files.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; I Basically have a working setup which deploys the zip file I generate to&#010;&gt;&gt; repo with the name I have specified. But the only thing that bothers me is&#010;&gt;&gt; that for some unclear reason the same zip is deployed again with the name&#010;&gt;&gt; of the project in the same deploy:file goal. To me - that is a bug.&#010;&gt;&gt; Should I open an issue instead somewhere and provide the patch which fixes&#010;&gt;&gt; this??&#010;&gt;&gt; I already mailed the email listed in the top of the java file in question&#010;&gt;&gt; but he does not reply.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Med venlig hilsen&#010;&gt;&gt; Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 2:54 PM, Anders Hammar &lt;anders@hammar.net&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;  You should really restart with the module 2 pom.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Your multi-module structure is good. You have a separate projekt/module&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; which creates your distro. What you should do is to create the "distro"&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; (zip or whatever) to be created as part of the normal build and then&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; deployed as the project's artifact it is.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; This is done in many projects and you could for example have a look at&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Maven core project where we create a zip and a tar file.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=maven.git;a=tree;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; f=apache-maven;hb=HEAD&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; So in the end, you will not use deploy:deploy-file. Also, your pom will&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; be&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; very small with pretty much only the m-assembly-p being bound to the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; build&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; lifecycle.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Name  :- &quot;Robert Scholte&quot; &lt;rfscho...@apache.org&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 - deploy-file goal - unable to avoid attachedArtifacts from being deployed in execute
contents:- Hi Henrik,&#010;&#010;IMHO deploy-file (just like install-file) should *never* be a part of a  &#010;lifecycle, but should be run standalone and should only be used for  &#010;unavailable third party artifacts.&#010;&#010;Looking back at your pom-fragment, you should do the following:&#010;* if "deploymentfile" is being created by a Maven plugin, try to make that  &#010;plugin attach that file to the project.&#010;* Use  &#010;http://mojo.codehaus.org/build-helper-maven-plugin/attach-artifact-mojo.html  &#010;and remove the deploy-file asap. This plugin does it's work as part of the  &#010;build lifecycle as it should be.&#010;&#010;Robert&#010;&#010;Op Sun, 16 Feb 2014 11:20:39 +0100 schreef Henrik Skriver Rasmussen  &#010;&lt;skriver79@gmail.com&gt;:&#010;&#010;&gt; Hi Robert&#010;&gt; Thank you for your answer.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; I would like to figure out how to simple skip the generation of the given&#010;&gt; extra zip file because I do not know how now.&#010;&gt; Any way to see during debug which goal will result in which artifact? Any&#010;&gt; help on finding out when running my build will be appreciated.&#010;&gt; I can not omit what I do not know to control nor can I not attach it  &#010;&gt; when I&#010;&gt; do no what generates it.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Not creating or attaching the artifact solves the problem - but still, as&#010;&gt; user of maven I still say that it is counter intuitive to have the&#010;&gt; deploy-file goal not only deploy the specified file.&#010;&gt; The deploy goal should deploy all - but not the deploy-file goal. :)&#010;&gt; I know that is a different discussion about meaningful naming of APIs and&#010;&gt; frankly I don't care now that I know.&#010;&gt; But maven developers should care about simplifying and make maven APIs&#010;&gt; intuitive since maven is not exactly gaining ground due to it's  &#010;&gt; simplicity&#010;&gt; and transparency. ;)&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; That being said, I have been using maven for a looong time and enjoy it&#010;&gt; most of the time - so keep up the good work!&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; regards&#010;&gt; Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; On Sun, Feb 16, 2014 at 2:03 PM, Robert Scholte  &#010;&gt; &lt;rfscholte@apache.org&gt;wrote:&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Op Sun, 16 Feb 2014 08:15:25 +0100 schreef Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;&#010;&gt;&gt; skriver79@gmail.com&gt;:&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;  Thanks for the advice on how to restructure.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Could you have a look at the deploy-plugin project and the file&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo execute method line 376  &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; in&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; version 2.8.1 ? I would really like to understand the following:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; 1) What controls which artifacts are attached the model for the given&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; project?&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; The plugin creating that artifact controls the attaching. For example:&#010;&gt;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-source-plugin/&#010;&gt;&gt; xref/org/apache/maven/plugin/source/AbstractSourceJarMojo.html#307&#010;&gt;&gt; Here the -sources.jar is attached to the project.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;  2) Is it possible to state that no artifacts except explicitly stated&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; should be created/attached?&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; The plugin creating that artifact&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;  3) Is it really the intended behaviour of the deploy:file goal to also&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; deploy the attached artifacts? To me that is a very non-intuitive&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; behaviour.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Yes. If there are attachments created and these are attached, they are&#010;&gt;&gt; uploaded as well. So if you don't want this, solve it at the source, i.e&#010;&gt;&gt; the plugin creating the artifact. (for the maven-source-plugin: skip it&#010;&gt;&gt; (best option) or just don't attach (acceptable option) )&#010;&gt;&gt; For the same reason you won't find "delete" options in any of the  &#010;&gt;&gt; plugins.&#010;&gt;&gt; It is a matter of excluding the correct files.&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; I Basically have a working setup which deploys the zip file I generate  &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; to&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; repo with the name I have specified. But the only thing that bothers  &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; me is&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; that for some unclear reason the same zip is deployed again with the  &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; name&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; of the project in the same deploy:file goal. To me - that is a bug.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Should I open an issue instead somewhere and provide the patch which  &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; fixes&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; this??&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; I already mailed the email listed in the top of the java file in  &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; question&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; but he does not reply.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Med venlig hilsen&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 2:54 PM, Anders Hammar &lt;anders@hammar.net&gt;  &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;  You should really restart with the module 2 pom.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Your multi-module structure is good. You have a separate  &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; projekt/module&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; which creates your distro. What you should do is to create the  &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; "distro"&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; (zip or whatever) to be created as part of the normal build and then&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; deployed as the project's artifact it is.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; This is done in many projects and you could for example have a look at&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Maven core project where we create a zip and a tar file.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=maven.git;a=tree;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; f=apache-maven;hb=HEAD&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; So in the end, you will not use deploy:deploy-file. Also, your pom  &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; will&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; be&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; very small with pretty much only the m-assembly-p being bound to the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; build&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; lifecycle.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; /Anders&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 11:36 AM, Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;  A (root and parent pom project)&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;  - module 1 - builds a jar as artifact&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;  - module 2  - uses module 1 jar artifact in assembly tries to  &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; contents:- Hi Robert&#010;Thanks - that sounds interesting and I will look into that Monday.&#010;But what is the right way to deploy a zip file build in the project to the artifactory repository&#010;then? Is it to only use deploy?&#010;&#010;Regards&#010;Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&#010;&gt; On Feb 16, 2014, at 14:47, "Robert Scholte" &lt;rfscholte@apache.org&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Hi Henrik,&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; IMHO deploy-file (just like install-file) should *never* be a part of a lifecycle, but&#010;should be run standalone and should only be used for unavailable third party artifacts.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Looking back at your pom-fragment, you should do the following:&#010;&gt; * if "deploymentfile" is being created by a Maven plugin, try to make that plugin attach&#010;that file to the project.&#010;&gt; * Use http://mojo.codehaus.org/build-helper-maven-plugin/attach-artifact-mojo.html and&#010;remove the deploy-file asap. This plugin does it's work as part of the build lifecycle as&#010;it should be.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Op Sun, 16 Feb 2014 11:20:39 +0100 schreef Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;skriver79@gmail.com&gt;:&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; Hi Robert&#010;&gt;&gt; Thank you for your answer.&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; I would like to figure out how to simple skip the generation of the given&#010;&gt;&gt; extra zip file because I do not know how now.&#010;&gt;&gt; Any way to see during debug which goal will result in which artifact? Any&#010;&gt;&gt; help on finding out when running my build will be appreciated.&#010;&gt;&gt; I can not omit what I do not know to control nor can I not attach it when I&#010;&gt;&gt; do no what generates it.&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; Not creating or attaching the artifact solves the problem - but still, as&#010;&gt;&gt; user of maven I still say that it is counter intuitive to have the&#010;&gt;&gt; deploy-file goal not only deploy the specified file.&#010;&gt;&gt; The deploy goal should deploy all - but not the deploy-file goal. :)&#010;&gt;&gt; I know that is a different discussion about meaningful naming of APIs and&#010;&gt;&gt; frankly I don't care now that I know.&#010;&gt;&gt; But maven developers should care about simplifying and make maven APIs&#010;&gt;&gt; intuitive since maven is not exactly gaining ground due to it's simplicity&#010;&gt;&gt; and transparency. ;)&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; That being said, I have been using maven for a looong time and enjoy it&#010;&gt;&gt; most of the time - so keep up the good work!&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; regards&#010;&gt;&gt; Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt; On Sun, Feb 16, 2014 at 2:03 PM, Robert Scholte &lt;rfscholte@apache.org&gt;wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Op Sun, 16 Feb 2014 08:15:25 +0100 schreef Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; skriver79@gmail.com&gt;:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Thanks for the advice on how to restructure.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Could you have a look at the deploy-plugin project and the file&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo execute method line 376 in&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; version 2.8.1 ? I would really like to understand the following:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; 1) What controls which artifacts are attached the model for the given&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; project?&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; The plugin creating that artifact controls the attaching. For example:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-source-plugin/&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; xref/org/apache/maven/plugin/source/AbstractSourceJarMojo.html#307&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Here the -sources.jar is attached to the project.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; 2) Is it possible to state that no artifacts except explicitly stated&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; should be created/attached?&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; The plugin creating that artifact&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; 3) Is it really the intended behaviour of the deploy:file goal to also&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; deploy the attached artifacts? To me that is a very non-intuitive&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; behaviour.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Yes. If there are attachments created and these are attached, they are&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; uploaded as well. So if you don't want this, solve it at the source, i.e&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; the plugin creating the artifact. (for the maven-source-plugin: skip it&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; (best option) or just don't attach (acceptable option) )&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; For the same reason you won't find "delete" options in any of the plugins.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; It is a matter of excluding the correct files.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; I Basically have a working setup which deploys the zip file I generate to&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; repo with the name I have specified. But the only thing that bothers me is&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; that for some unclear reason the same zip is deployed again with the name&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; of the project in the same deploy:file goal. To me - that is a bug.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Should I open an issue instead somewhere and provide the patch which fixes&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; this??&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; I already mailed the email listed in the top of the java file in question&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; but he does not reply.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Med venlig hilsen&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 2:54 PM, Anders Hammar &lt;anders@hammar.net&gt;&#010;wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; You should really restart with the module 2 pom.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Your multi-module structure is good. You have a separate projekt/module&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; which creates your distro. What you should do is to create the "distro"&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; (zip or whatever) to be created as part of the normal build and then&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; deployed as the project's artifact it is.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; This is done in many projects and you could for example have a look at&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Maven core project where we create a zip and a tar file.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=maven.git;a=tree;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; f=apache-maven;hb=HEAD&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; So in the end, you will not use deploy:deploy-file. Also, your pom will&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; be&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; very small with pretty much only the m-assembly-p being bound to the&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; build&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Is this intended behaviour and if so how can I avoid this&#010;from&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; happening?&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; The goal name deploy-file indicates that one artifact&#010;(possible&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; incl.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; pom/metadata) is to be deployed and not also a throng&#010;of other&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; artifacts.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; I will be happy to provide a patch where this is aspect&#010;is removed.&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; Thank you in advance&#010;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Is it to only use deploy?&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Regards&#010;&gt; Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; On Feb 16, 2014, at 14:47, "Robert Scholte" &lt;rfscholte@apache.org&gt;&#010;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Hi Henrik,&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; IMHO deploy-file (just like install-file) should *never* be a part of a&#010;&gt; lifecycle, but should be run standalone and should only be used for&#010;&gt; unavailable third party artifacts.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Looking back at your pom-fragment, you should do the following:&#010;&gt; &gt; * if "deploymentfile" is being created by a Maven plugin, try to make&#010;&gt; that plugin attach that file to the project.&#010;&gt; &gt; * Use&#010;&gt; http://mojo.codehaus.org/build-helper-maven-plugin/attach-artifact-mojo.htmland remove&#010;the deploy-file asap. This plugin does it's work as part of the&#010;&gt; build lifecycle as it should be.&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Robert&#010;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt; Op Sun, 16 Feb 2014 11:20:39 +0100 schreef Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; I can not omit what I do not know to control nor can I not attach it&#010;&gt; when I&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; do no what generates it.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; Not creating or attaching the artifact solves the problem - but still,&#010;&gt; as&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; user of maven I still say that it is counter intuitive to have the&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; deploy-file goal not only deploy the specified file.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; The deploy goal should deploy all - but not the deploy-file goal. :)&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; I know that is a different discussion about meaningful naming of APIs&#010;&gt; and&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; frankly I don't care now that I know.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt; But maven developers should care about simplifying and make maven APIs&#010;&gt; On Sun, Feb 16, 2014 at 2:03 PM, Robert Scholte &lt;rfscholte@apache.org&#010;&gt; &gt;wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Op Sun, 16 Feb 2014 08:15:25 +0100 schreef Henrik Skriver Rasmussen &lt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; skriver79@gmail.com&gt;:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Thanks for the advice on how to restructure.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Could you have a look at the deploy-plugin project and the file&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo execute method line 376&#010;&gt; in&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; version 2.8.1 ? I would really like to understand the following:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; 1) What controls which artifacts are attached the model for the given&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; project?&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; The plugin creating that artifact controls the attaching. For example:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-source-plugin/&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; xref/org/apache/maven/plugin/source/AbstractSourceJarMojo.html#307&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Here the -sources.jar is attached to the project.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; 2) Is it possible to state that no artifacts except explicitly stated&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; should be created/attached?&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; The plugin creating that artifact&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; 3) Is it really the intended behaviour of the deploy:file goal to also&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; deploy the attached artifacts? To me that is a very non-intuitive&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; behaviour.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Yes. If there are attachments created and these are attached, they are&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; uploaded as well. So if you don't want this, solve it at the source,&#010;&gt; i.e&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; the plugin creating the artifact. (for the maven-source-plugin: skip it&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; (best option) or just don't attach (acceptable option) )&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; For the same reason you won't find "delete" options in any of the&#010;&gt; plugins.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; It is a matter of excluding the correct files.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt; Robert&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; I Basically have a working setup which deploys the zip file I&#010;&gt; generate to&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; repo with the name I have specified. But the only thing that bothers&#010;&gt; me is&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; that for some unclear reason the same zip is deployed again with the&#010;&gt; name&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; of the project in the same deploy:file goal. To me - that is a bug.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Should I open an issue instead somewhere and provide the patch which&#010;&gt; fixes&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; this??&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; I already mailed the email listed in the top of the java file in&#010;&gt; question&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; but he does not reply.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Med venlig hilsen&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 2:54 PM, Anders Hammar &lt;anders@hammar.net&gt;&#010;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; You should really restart with the module 2 pom.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Your multi-module structure is good. You have a separate&#010;&gt; projekt/module&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; which creates your distro. What you should do is to create the&#010;&gt; "distro"&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; (zip or whatever) to be created as part of the normal build and&#010;then&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; deployed as the project's artifact it is.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; This is done in many projects and you could for example have a look&#010;&gt; at&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; the&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; Maven core project where we create a zip and a tar file.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=maven.git;a=tree;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; f=apache-maven;hb=HEAD&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; So in the end, you will not use deploy:deploy-file. &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;/goals&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &lt;finalName&gt;${project.parent.artifactId}-${project.parent.version}&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &lt;/finalName&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;outputDirectory&gt;${project.build.directory}/&lt;/outputDirectory&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;filtering&gt;true&lt;/filtering&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;descriptors&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;      &lt;descriptor&gt;assembly/dist.xml&lt;/descriptor&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;/descriptors&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;    &lt;/execution&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;    &lt;/executions&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;   &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;   &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;    &lt;groupId&gt;org.apache.maven.plugins&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;    &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-deploy-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;    &lt;executions&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;    &lt;execution&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;id&gt;cookbook&lt;/id&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;phase&gt;deploy&lt;/phase&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;goals&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;goal&gt;deploy-file&lt;/goal&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;/goals&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;                       &lt;primaryArtifact&gt;false&lt;/primaryArtifact&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;repositoryId&gt;artifactory&lt;/repositoryId&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;packaging&gt;zip&lt;/packaging&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;url&gt;${project.distributionManagement.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; snapshotRepository.url}&lt;/url&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;generatePom&gt;false&lt;/generatePom&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;artifactId&gt;${project.parent.artifactId}&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;groupId&gt;${project.parent.groupId}&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;version&gt;${project.parent.version}&lt;/version&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;classifier&gt;deploymentfile&lt;/classifier&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;file&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; ${project.build.directory}/${project.parent.artifactId}-${&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; project.parent.version}-deploymentfile.zip&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;/file&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;     &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;    &lt;/execution&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;    &lt;/executions&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;   &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;   &lt;/plugins&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;  &lt;/build&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;  &lt;/profile&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &lt;/profiles&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &lt;/project&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; Med venlig hilsen&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 2:15 PM, Anders Hammar &lt;anders@hammar.net&gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; You need to provide more info on what you're doing! Is&#010;the&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; deploy:deploy-file bound to the build lifecycle of a project?&#010;&gt; How?&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; /Anders&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 11:06 AM, Henrik Skriver Rasmussen&#010;&lt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; skriver79@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; Hi&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; I have a question about the expected behaviour of&#010;the&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; deploy:deploy-file&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; goal in the maven deploy plugin 2.8.1 which I am&#010;currently&#010;&gt; using to&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; deploy&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; one file.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; It surprised me that no matter what I did I kept&#010;getting more&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; artifacts&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; deployed that I asked for and the reason is in the&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; org.apache.maven.plugin.deploy.DeployFileMojo.execute&#010;line 376&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; where&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; the&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; attached artifacts are also deployed.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; Is this intended behaviour and if so how can I avoid&#010;this from&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; happening?&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; The goal name deploy-file indicates that one artifact&#010;(possible&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; incl.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; pom/metadata) is to be deployed and not also a throng&#010;of other&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; artifacts.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; I will be happy to provide a patch where this is&#010;aspect is&#010;&gt; removed.&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; Thank you in advance&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt;&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; regards&#010;&gt; &gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt; &gt; &gt; &gt; The difference between them is&#010;only target URL.&#010;&#010;Is there any possibility to make one profile with parameters which will be&#010;taken from file or any other solution to make one profile instead of many.&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;--&#010;View this message in context: http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/How-to-minimize-quantity-of-profiles-in-pom-xml-file-tp5784478.html&#010;Sent from the Maven - Users mailing list archive at Nabble.com.&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Jörg Schaible &lt;joerg.schai...@swisspost.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: How to minimize quantity of profiles in pom.xml file
contents:- fred wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; I need to build project for many kinds of environment so i need a lot of&#010;&gt; profiles with settings for this env.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; There is a cutted module pom.xml -  pom.xml file&#010;&gt; &lt;http://www.mediafire.com/view/47gt5jiegta7auq/pom.xml&gt;&#010;&#010;All you need in the profile is a simple property:&#010;&#010;===================== %&lt; ====================&#010; &lt;build&gt;&#010;   &lt;plugins&gt;&#010;     ...&#010;     &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;       ... your plugin ...&#010;       &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;        ... your configuration ...&#010;        &lt;targetURL&gt;http://${profile.host}:&#010;${port}/crx/packmgr/service.jsp&lt;/targetURL&gt;&#010;       &lt;/configuration&gt;&#010;       ...&#010;     &lt;/plugin&gt;&#010;   &lt;/plugins&gt;&#010;   ...&#010; &lt;/build&gt;&#010; &lt;profiles&gt;&#010;   &lt;profile&gt;&#010;     &lt;id&gt;auto-deploy&lt;/id&gt;&#010;     &lt;properties&gt;&#010;       &lt;profile.host&gt;${host}&lt;/profile.host&gt;&#010;     &lt;/properties&gt;&#010;   &lt;/profile&gt;&#010;   &lt;profile&gt;&#010;     &lt;id&gt;dev&lt;/id&gt;&#010;     &lt;properties&gt;&#010;       &lt;profile.host&gt;${dev.host}&lt;/profile.host&gt;&#010;     &lt;/properties&gt;&#010;   &lt;/profile&gt;&#010;   ...&#010; &lt;/profiles&gt;&#010;===================== %&lt; ====================&#010;&#010;As rule of thumb: Just put the stuff into the profile that *is* actually &#010;different.&#010;&#010;- Jörg&#010;&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Ron Wheeler &lt;rwhee...@artifact-software.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: How to minimize quantity of profiles in pom.xml file
contents:- Have you thought about using an installer like IzPack that can organize &#010;your configurations for each environment.&#010;Installers know about different OSs and different combinations of modules.&#010;Build tools build modules and generally don't care much about deployment.&#010;&#010;I mention IzPack since it is FOSS and has a Maven plug-in so it fits &#010;well and understands about platform-specific configurations.&#010;&#010;Ron&#010;&#010;On 14/02/2014 5:06 AM, fred wrote:&#010;&gt; I need to build project for many kinds of environment so i need a lot of&#010;&gt; profiles with settings for this env.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; There is a cutted module pom.xml -  pom.xml file&#010;&gt; &lt;http://www.mediafire.com/view/47gt5jiegta7auq/pom.xml&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; --&#010;&gt; View this message in context: http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/How-to-minimize-quantity-of-profiles-in-pom-xml-file-tp5784478p5784835.html&#010;&gt; Sent from the Maven - Users mailing list archive at Nabble.com.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Ron Wheeler&#010;President&#010;Artifact Software Inc&#010;email: rwheeler@artifact-software.com&#010;skype: ronaldmwheeler&#010;phone: 866-970-2435, ext 102&#010;&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Ron Wheeler &lt;rwhee...@artifact-software.com&gt;
Subject  :-Multiple assemblies in a pom
contents:- I am trying to create 3 tar files in a single project.&#010;I have 3 invocations of the  maven-assembly-plugin in the pom.&#010;It works but gives the warnings shown below.&#010;&#010;How likely is it that these dire threats of future problems will come about?&#010;&#010;What is the Best Practice to fix this?&#010;&#010;Ron&#010;&#010;&#010;[WARNING] Some problems were encountered while building the effective &#010;model for com.artifact_software.taw:taw-webapps-assembler:jar:1.0.2&#010;[WARNING] 'build.plugins.plugin.(groupId:artifactId)' must be unique but &#010;found duplicate declaration of plugin &#010;org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-assembly&#010;-plugin @ line 77, column 12&#010;[WARNING] 'build.plugins.plugin.(groupId:artifactId)' must be unique but &#010;found duplicate declaration of plugin &#010;org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-assembly&#010;-plugin @ line 89, column 12&#010;[WARNING]&#010;[WARNING] It is highly recommended to fix these problems because they &#010;threaten the stability of your build.&#010;[WARNING]&#010;[WARNING] For this reason, future Maven versions might no longer support &#010;building such malformed projects.&#010;&#010;&#010;-- &#010;Ron Wheeler&#010;President&#010;Artifact Software Inc&#010;email: rwheeler@artifact-software.com&#010;skype: ronaldmwheeler&#010;phone: 866-970-2435, ext 102&#010;&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Anders Hammar &lt;and...@hammar.net&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Multiple assemblies in a pom
contents:- You should have multiple execution declarations. Not plugin declarations.&#010;&#010;/Anders&#010;&#010;&#010;On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 1:59 PM, Ron Wheeler &lt;rwheeler@artifact-software.com&#010;&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; I am trying to create 3 tar files in a single project.&#010;&gt; I have 3 invocations of the  maven-assembly-plugin in the pom.&#010;&gt; It works but gives the warnings shown below.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; How likely is it that these dire threats of future problems will come&#010;&gt; about?&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; What is the Best Practice to fix this?&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Ron&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; [WARNING] Some problems were encountered while building the effective&#010;&gt; model for com.artifact_software.taw:taw-webapps-assembler:jar:1.0.2&#010;&gt; [WARNING] 'build.plugins.plugin.(groupId:artifactId)' must be unique but&#010;&gt; found duplicate declaration of plugin org.apache.maven.plugins:&#010;&gt; maven-assembly&#010;&gt; -plugin @ line 77, column 12&#010;&gt; [WARNING] 'build.plugins.plugin.(groupId:artifactId)' must be unique but&#010;&gt; found duplicate declaration of plugin org.apache.maven.plugins:&#010;&gt; maven-assembly&#010;&gt; -plugin @ line 89, column 12&#010;&gt; [WARNING]&#010;&gt; [WARNING] It is highly recommended to fix these problems because they&#010;&gt; threaten the stability of your build.&#010;&gt; [WARNING]&#010;&gt; [WARNING] For this reason, future Maven versions might no longer support&#010;&gt; building such malformed projects.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; --&#010;&gt; Ron Wheeler&#010;&gt; President&#010;&gt; Artifact Software Inc&#010;&gt; email: rwheeler@artifact-software.com&#010;&gt; skype: ronaldmwheeler&#010;&gt; phone: 866-970-2435, ext 102&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- DenisDasKind &lt;blto...@abv.bg&gt;
Subject  :-Maven parent POM - execute plugin after the submodule execution
contents:- Hi Everybody, in my project i have a pom, that contains some childs&#010;(submodules). The pom was defined as pom packaging type, and all is working&#010;fine. But now i must execute a maven plugin, that should be executed after&#010;the submodule build was finished. Is this possible, and when not, how can i&#010;realize this? The parent pom is only a aggregator pom.&#010;&#010;Thank you in Advance!&#010;&#010;Regards,&#010;Denis&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;--&#010;View this message in context: http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/Maven-parent-POM-execute-plugin-after-the-submodule-execution-tp5784481.html&#010;Sent from the Maven - Users mailing list archive at Nabble.com.&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- Wayne Fay &lt;wayne...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven parent POM - execute plugin after the submodule execution
contents:- Just add another submodule.&#010;Make it depend on the "last" submodule (eg you had A, B, C before -&#010;make this D, and depend on C, assumes C depends on B which depends on&#010;A).&#010;Add the plugin to D.&#010;&#010;Wayne&#010;&#010;On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 7:04 AM, DenisDasKind &lt;bltomov@abv.bg&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; Hi Everybody, in my project i have a pom, that contains some childs&#010;&gt; (submodules). The pom was defined as pom packaging type, and all is working&#010;&gt; fine. But now i must execute a maven plugin, that should be executed after&#010;&gt; the submodule build was finished. Is this possible, and when not, how can i&#010;&gt; realize this? The parent pom is only a aggregator pom.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Thank you in Advance!&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; Regards,&#010;&gt; Denis&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; --&#010;&gt; View this message in context: http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/Maven-parent-POM-execute-plugin-after-the-submodule-execution-tp5784481.html&#010;&gt; Sent from the Maven - Users mailing list archive at Nabble.com.&#010;&gt;&#010;&gt; ---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;&gt; To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt; For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&gt;&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Alex Potsides &lt;a...@achingbrain.net&gt;
Subject  :-Maven Site Plugin and report plugins that need dependencies declared
contents:- I'm sorry if this question has been asked already but I couldn't find much&#010;in the archives.&#010;&#010;I'm trying to convert some existing build plugins to instead be report&#010;plugins with v3.3 of maven-site-plugin.  One of the plugins needs an extra&#010;dependency to be specified.  When it lived as a direct child of&#010;build/plugins this was ok, but when I do this sort of thing:&#010;&#010;&lt;plugin&gt;&#010;  &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-site-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;  &lt;version&gt;3.3&lt;/version&gt;&#010;  &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;    &lt;reportPlugins&gt;&#010;     &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;       &lt;groupId&gt;..&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;       &lt;artifactId&gt;..&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;       &lt;version&gt;..&lt;/version&gt;&#010;       &lt;dependencies&gt;&#010;         &lt;dependency&gt;&#010;           &lt;artifactId&gt;..&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;           &lt;groupId&gt;..&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;           ...&#010;&#010;I get:&#010;&#010;Cannot find setter, adder nor field in&#010;org.apache.maven.reporting.exec.ReportPlugin for 'dependencies'&#010;&#010;Is this sort of configuration not possible?&#010;&#010;Thanks in advance.&#010;&#010;Alex Potsides&#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- Hervé BOUTEMY &lt;herve.bout...@free.fr&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven Site Plugin and report plugins that need dependencies declared
contents:- I'll make it short: please don't use reportPlugins in m-site-p configuration&#010;&#010;see http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-site-plugin/maven-3.html#Configuration_formats&#010;&#010;use classic configuration and everything will work fine&#010;&#010;Regards,&#010;&#010;Hervé&#010;&#010;Le jeudi 13 février 2014 15:34:03 Alex Potsides a écrit :&#010;&gt; I'm sorry if this question has been asked already but I couldn't find much&#010;&gt; in the archives.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; I'm trying to convert some existing build plugins to instead be report&#010;&gt; plugins with v3.3 of maven-site-plugin.  One of the plugins needs an extra&#010;&gt; dependency to be specified.  When it lived as a direct child of&#010;&gt; build/plugins this was ok, but when I do this sort of thing:&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt;   &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-site-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt;   &lt;version&gt;3.3&lt;/version&gt;&#010;&gt;   &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt;     &lt;reportPlugins&gt;&#010;&gt;      &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;groupId&gt;..&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;artifactId&gt;..&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;version&gt;..&lt;/version&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;dependencies&gt;&#010;&gt;          &lt;dependency&gt;&#010;&gt;            &lt;artifactId&gt;..&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt;            &lt;groupId&gt;..&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;&gt;            ...&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; I get:&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Cannot find setter, adder nor field in&#010;&gt; org.apache.maven.reporting.exec.ReportPlugin for 'dependencies'&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Is this sort of configuration not possible?&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Thanks in advance.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; Alex Potsides&#010;&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- jieryn &lt;jie...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven Site Plugin and report plugins that need dependencies declared
contents:- Even though Hervé has given the best answer, I thought I'd chime in&#010;and say that The Maven Way would probably have you add the additional&#010;dependency at the plugin level, and not the&#010;configuration.reportPlugins.plugin level.. So, sorry, but you were&#010;wrong twice. :-)&#010;&#010;On Thu, Feb 13, 2014 at 10:34 AM, Alex Potsides &lt;alex@achingbrain.net&gt; wrote:&#010;&gt; &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt;   &lt;artifactId&gt;maven-site-plugin&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt;   &lt;version&gt;3.3&lt;/version&gt;&#010;&gt;   &lt;configuration&gt;&#010;&gt;     &lt;reportPlugins&gt;&#010;&gt;      &lt;plugin&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;groupId&gt;..&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;artifactId&gt;..&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;version&gt;..&lt;/version&gt;&#010;&gt;        &lt;dependencies&gt;&#010;&gt;          &lt;dependency&gt;&#010;&gt;            &lt;artifactId&gt;..&lt;/artifactId&gt;&#010;&gt;            &lt;groupId&gt;..&lt;/groupId&gt;&#010;&gt;            ...&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Alex Potsides &lt;a...@achingbrain.net&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Maven Site Plugin and report plugins that need dependencies declared
contents:- Not sure I follow.  Are you saying that if I need to add a dependency to a&#010;project.build.plugins.plugin.configuration.reportPlugins.plugin I should do&#010;it at project.build.plugins.plugin instead?  E.g. as an additional&#010;dependency of the maven-site-plugin itself?  If so, I tried that and was&#010;unsurprised when it didn't work.  The maven-site-plugin does not appear to&#010;share it's classpath with child reportPlugins and quite rightly so.&#010;&#010;Following Hervé's advice I'm now using the older project.reporting.plugins&#010;config instead.  However due to&#010;http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MSITE-444(unresolved since 2007)&#010;project.reporting.plugins.plugin can't hold a&#010;dependencies element so the whole thing is a bust.&#010;&#010;a.&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;On Fri, Feb 14, 2014 at 12:19 PM, jieryn &lt;jieryn@gmail.com&gt; wrote:&#010;&#010;&gt; Even though Hervé has given the best answer, I thought I'd chime in&#010;&gt; and say that The Maven Way would probably have you add the additional&#010;&gt; dependency at the plugin level, and not the&#010;&gt; configuration.reportPlugins.plugin level.. Name  :- Dan Tran &lt;dant...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Strange Array configuration for plugin params
contents:- A contributor for MOJO-2006 [1] uses array configuration at&#010;&#010;http://maven.apache.org/guides/plugin/guide-java-plugin-development.html (&#010;array session)&#010;&#010;here is the text&#010;&#010;    /**&#010;     * My List.&#010;     */&#010;    @Parameter&#010;    private List myList;&#010;&#010;&lt;myList&gt;&#010;  &lt;param&gt;value1&lt;/param&gt;&#010;  &lt;param&gt;value2&lt;/param&gt;&#010;&lt;/myList&gt;&#010;&#010;For details on the mapping of the individual collection elements, see Mapping&#010;Lists&lt;http://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-configuring-plugins.html#Mapping_Lists&gt;&#010;.&#010;&#010;&#010;However if you drill down to 'Mapping Lists' it has the usual configuration&#010;that we are custom-ed to&#010;&#010;  &lt;animals&gt;&#010;    &lt;animal&gt;cat&lt;/animal&gt;&#010;    &lt;animal&gt;dog&lt;/animal&gt;&#010;    &lt;animal&gt;aardvark&lt;/animal&gt;&#010;   &lt;/animals&gt;&#010;&#010;is it there by accident? or the plugin api support both format?&#010;&#010;&#010;Thanks&#010;&#010;&#010;[1] https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MOJO-2006&#010;&#010;

Name  :- DenisDasKind &lt;blto...@abv.bg&gt;
Subject  :-Prevent installing archives to local repository
contents:- Hi everybody,&#010;&#010;one of my project create multiple jar and zip files during the build life&#010;cycle, and each archive was created with the maven assembly plugin. And now&#010;i see, that some of the files are installing to the local repository and&#010;some not. The files that i need are installed to the repository, but there&#010;is also a file that should not be installed. My question is how maven&#010;install plugin detect which file should be installed and which not, and is&#010;there a possibility to control this process and define that a specific file&#010;shouldn't be installed.&#010;&#010;Thank you in advance!&#010;&#010;Regards,&#010;DenisDasKind&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;--&#010;View this message in context: http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/Prevent-installing-archives-to-local-repository-tp5784848.html&#010;Sent from the Maven - Users mailing list archive at Nabble.com.&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Wayne Fay &lt;wayne...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Prevent installing archives to local repository
contents:- &gt; i see, that some of the files are installing to the local repository and&#010;&gt; some not. The files that i need are installed to the repository, but there&#010;&gt; is also a file that should not be installed. My question is how maven&#010;&#010;Can you be more specific about "the file that should not be&#010;installed"? What is special about it?&#010;&#010;&gt; install plugin detect which file should be installed and which not, and is&#010;&gt; there a possibility to control this process and define that a specific file&#010;&gt; shouldn't be installed.&#010;&#010;Perhaps share your pom so we can comment on improvements? Please don't&#010;just email it here - post to pastebin or a similar service and send us&#010;the link.&#010;&#010;Wayne&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- DenisDasKind &lt;blto...@abv.bg&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Prevent installing archives to local repository
contents:- I have take a look, and found that each file, created with the maven assembly&#010;plugin was installed to the local repository under the project name. In my&#010;case the maven assembly plugin creates a file abc.zip that is part of the&#010;distribution, and maven install plugin installed the abs.zip to the local&#010;repository as projectName.zip and the distribution file.&#010;My idea is to skip the installation of abc.zip to the repository because it&#010;is only temporary needed, and is part of the distribution zip file.&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;--&#010;View this message in context: http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/Prevent-installing-archives-to-local-repository-tp5784848p5785132.html&#010;Sent from the Maven - Users mailing list archive at Nabble.com.&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- Karl Heinz Marbaise &lt;khmarba...@gmx.de&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Prevent installing archives to local repository
contents:- Hi,&#010;&#010; &gt; I have take a look, and found that each file, created with the maven &#010;assembly&#010;&gt; plugin was installed to the local repository under the project name. In my&#010;&gt; case the maven assembly plugin creates a file abc.zip that is part of the&#010;&gt; distribution, and maven install plugin installed the abs.zip to the local&#010;&gt; repository as projectName.zip and the distribution file.&#010;&gt; My idea is to skip the installation of abc.zip to the repository because it&#010;&gt; is only temporary needed, and is part of the distribution zip file.&#010;&#010;There is an parameter for the maven-assembly-plugin&#010;http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-assembly-plugin/single-mojo.html&#010;&#010;which allows to suppress attaching an artifact in particular if you have &#010;intermediate results which you don't like to attach to the project..&#010;&#010;&lt;attach&gt;false&lt;/attach&gt;&#010;&#010;which needs having a separate execution block...&#010;&#010;Kind regards&#010;Karl-Heinz Marbaise&#010;&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

================

Name  :- DenisDasKind &lt;blto...@abv.bg&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Prevent installing archives to local repository
contents:- Thank you,&#010;&#010;it works fine. I it seems i have ignored this parameter from the&#010;documentation. It was my mistake.&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;--&#010;View this message in context: http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/Prevent-installing-archives-to-local-repository-tp5784848p5785135.html&#010;Sent from the Maven - Users mailing list archive at Nabble.com.&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- LevskiWeng &lt;levskiw...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Why does Maven fail to compile my project occasionally?
contents:- Sorry for that, I forgot to translate all the Chinese characters into&#010;English, those Chinese characters have the same meaning of 'Cannot find the&#010;symbol'.&#010;&#010;I will change the compilers to javac and see what will happen. I'll post my&#010;result later.&#010;&#010;The reason why I'm deleting my local repository is that when I delete a&#010;.java file in my project when developing, the maven treats the module as&#010;unmodified and skips to the next module. And I use this workaround to make&#010;sure all the modules are up-to-date.&#010;&#010;  &#010;&#010;Ron Wheeler wrote&#010;&gt; Since the error message is in Chinese it is a bit difficult to tell.&#010;&gt; Why are you deleting your local repo?&#010;&gt; Is it possible that you are using different compilers?&#010;&gt; How is TYPE_AGENT_ID source com compiles - same pom?&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; On 14/02/2014 9:12 AM, Levski Weng wrote:&#010;&gt;&gt; Hello, I'm new to Maven. contents:- The parameters is missing, sorry:&#010;clean install -Dmaven.test.skip=true --update-snapshots --batch-mode&#010;--fail-fast --debug -Dmaven.compiler.forceJavacCompilerUse=true&#010;-Dmaven.compiler.verbose=true&#010;&#010;&#010;LevskiWeng wrote&#010;&gt; After changing the compiler to javac, and add verbose parameters as the&#010;&gt; following:&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;--&#010;View this message in context: http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/Why-does-Maven-fail-to-compile-my-project-occasionally-tp5784849p5784861.html&#010;Sent from the Maven - Users mailing list archive at Nabble.com.&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- Wayne Fay &lt;wayne...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Why does Maven fail to compile my project occasionally?
contents:- &gt; I've written a Windows batch file to invoke Maven to build the project&#010;&gt; before I choose Jenkins as my daily build system. And at that time I got&#010;&gt; the same Maven error as I described in this thread.&#010;&#010;Maven calls out to your system JDK to do the compilation step. With&#010;the [ERROR] lines you provided previously, Maven is simply passing&#010;along the error that was reported by javac. I bet, if you constructed&#010;the proper javac call (which can be seen in Maven's logs if you use -X&#010;for debug mode), you would see the same error produced without&#010;involving Maven (or Jenkins) at all.&#010;&#010;IIRC you had some "cannot find symbol" errors. What do you expect&#010;Maven to do about code defects reported by the Java compiler? Why are&#010;you blaming Maven for this?&#010;&#010;&gt; I'll post some other source code and POM files later. Please help me to&#010;&gt; diagnose my problem then. Thanks.&#010;&#010;Please don't try to send attachments or huge logs, source code, pom&#010;files to the list. Instead post it to Pastebin or Gist and send us a&#010;link.&#010;&#010;Wayne&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;

Name  :- LevskiWeng &lt;levskiw...@gmail.com&gt;
Subject  :-Re: Why does Maven fail to compile my project occasionally?
contents:- Wayne Fay wrote&#010;&gt; Maven calls out to your system JDK to do the compilation step. With&#010;&gt; the [ERROR] lines you provided previously, Maven is simply passing&#010;&gt; along the error that was reported by javac. I bet, if you constructed&#010;&gt; the proper javac call (which can be seen in Maven's logs if you use -X&#010;&gt; for debug mode), you would see the same error produced without&#010;&gt; involving Maven (or Jenkins) at all.&#010;&gt; &#010;&gt; IIRC you had some "cannot find symbol" errors. What do you expect&#010;&gt; Maven to do about code defects reported by the Java compiler? Why are&#010;&gt; you blaming Maven for this?&#010;&#010;After digging into the dependency tree described in each module's pom.xml&#010;for several days, I found that you're right. It's my fault, not Maven's.&#010;It's because my code depends some other modules which I didn't put it into&#010;pom.xml explicitly. And I'm adding them into the corresponding pom.xml.&#010;Thank you for directing me back to the right track!&#010;&#010;However, I'm curious that I succeed to compile the project after several&#010;compilation failure. How does it happen? I've passed the parameter 'clean&#010;install -Dmaven.test.skip=true --update-snapshots --batch-mode --fail-fast&#010;--debug -Dmaven.compiler.forceJavacCompilerUse=true&#010;-Dmaven.compiler.verbose=true' to Maven, but it doesn't get the same error&#010;when I compile the project the second time. And it mislead me to blame Maven&#010;;-)&#010;&#010;Could anyone explain the somewhat weird behavior of Maven? Thanks.&#010;&#010;&#010;&#010;--&#010;View this message in context: http://maven.40175.n5.nabble.com/Why-does-Maven-fail-to-compile-my-project-occasionally-tp5784849p5785441.html&#010;Sent from the Maven - Users mailing list archive at Nabble.com.&#010;&#010;---------------------------------------------------------------------&#010;To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@maven.apache.org&#010;For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@maven.apache.org&#010;&#010;&#010;
